Title: Junior Data Scientist - Area Products & Services
Description:
Company Description

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

Position

Inserito all'interno della Unit Business Intelligence – appartenente all'Area Global Business,

la risorsa da noi ricercata si occuperà di fornire supporto analitico con particolare focus sull’area Brokerage.

In questo ambito si occuperà di analisi relative allo sviluppo di nuovi prodotti e al monitoraggio del portafoglio prodotti esistenti. Le analisi riguardano i prodotti da tutti i punti di vista: dalla Customer Base, al Pricing, alla Redditività.

Dovrà possedere doti di precisione e autonomia, partendo dalla comprensione del problema di business, fino all’estrazione dei dati e alla presentazione dei risultati.

Considerata la centralità del ruolo all’interno del processo di sviluppo prodotti, la risorsa dovrà essere in grado di comunicare con colleghi delle diverse aree della Banca: dal Business, al Risk management, dal Finance all’IT:

Attività


Effettuare analisi in autonomia, dalla fase di estrazione dati alla presentazione dei risultati
Produrre report automatizzati utilizzando tool di Business Intelligence
Costruire modelli predittivi al fine di ottimizzare le azioni di marketing



Requirements

Requisiti


Laurea in Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale, Statistica o Matematica
Forte interesse per la finanza, il trading e gli investimenti
Esperienza fino a 3 anni in ruoli analoghi
Eccellenti abilità analitiche e quantitative
Dimostrato interesse per Machine Learning e le analisi di marketing
Buone capacità di interpretazione e di comunicazione dei risultati
Conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione (R, Python, Matlab)
Conoscenza di SQL o database relazionali
Ottima conoscenza di Excel e PowerPoint



Verranno Considerati Un Plus


Conoscenza di applicativi di Business Intelligence
Conoscenza di cluster analysis, modelli di regressione e classificazione, alberi decisionali



Completano il profilo l’entusiasmo e la proattività nel cercare e proporre soluzioni, capacità di lavorare sotto pressione, attitudine al team working e doti relazionali.

Other information

Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

Il Gruppo Fineco è orgoglioso di essere un Equal Opportunity Employer e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro sicuro e inclusivo, fondato sul rispetto reciproco e la valorizzazione di qualsiasi diversità, offrendo pari opportunità di lavoro. Fineco “The Place To Be”

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you looking for a new challenge?

Fancy helping us shape the future of car insurance?

Prima could be the place for you.

Since 2015, we’ve been using our love of data and tech to rethink car insurance and bring drivers a great experience at a great price. Our story began in Italy, where we’ve quickly become the number one online motor insurance provider. In fact, we’re trusted by over 4 million drivers. And now we’re expanding to help millions more drivers in the UK and Spain.

To help fuel that growth, we need a Data Scientist to join our Italian Pricing & Underwritingteam (if you're curious, you can get a glimpse of the team's life here ).

This team is the strategic engine behind Prima’s growth.

As part of this team, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping our strategy and strengthening our competitive edge. Using creativity, data and machine learning, you’ll help predict the future and set the right prices, keeping our offering both attractive and sustainable. You’ll work with your data science tools and skills to bring real-world impact, collaborating with cross-functional teams to turn insights into action and fuel innovation across the company.

Excited to make an impact? Here are the details

What You’ll Do


Leverage Machine Learning and advanced data analytics to identify risks and opportunities for each new client;
Analyze and interpret complex data to support strategic decision-making;
Contribute directly to the company’s growth and long-term success through actionable insights.


What We’re Looking For


Academic Excellence: Impressive academic achievements in Mathematics, Physics, Mathematical Engineering, Physical Engineering, or Statistics;
Experience Not Required: No prior work experience? No problem! We're eager to invest in your talent and education;
Analytical Prowess: Strong quantitative, logical, and analytical skills are essential. At Prima, you'll tackle diverse and stimulating challenges that will put your skills to the test;
Curiosity and Innovation: We value curiosity, proactivity, and pragmatism. You'll be encouraged to pursue common goals in original and innovative ways, shaping the future with your ideas.


Nice-to-have


Have international experience and are fluency in English;
Possess a solid foundation in programming and machine learning;
Know how to create, manipulate and analyze large datasets.


Why you’ll love it here

We want to make Prima a happy and empowering place to work. So if you decide to join us, you can expect plenty of perks.

🤸 Work Your Way: Enjoy full flexibility – work from home, the office or a mix of both. Plus, work from anywhere for up to 30 days a year.

🏁 Grow with us: We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. Get access to learning resources, mentorship and a growth plan tailored to you.

🌈 Thrive and perform: Your best work begins when you feel your best. Enjoy private healthcare, gym discounts, wellbeing programs and mental health support.

Think you’re a match? Apply now.

At Prima, we celebrate uniqueness. If you don’t meet every requirement but are passionate about this role, we still want to hear from you. Innovation thrives on diverse perspectives.

Prima is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Need accommodations during the process? Email us at talent.acquisition@prima.it. Let’s build the future of insurance, together.

Title: Marketing - Data Scientist
Description:
Full-time


Job Description

About the job :

West Europe Marketing Science team is a specialist business unit providing consulting and advanced statistics across the NIQ SA&I portfolio. We act as consultants for statistical/ technical advice, input into client proposals, as well as support to research teams in the design & execution of all client projects.

The team, spread across Europe, share the same vision to learn, develop and share the latest cutting-edge methods.

Working with colleagues across country borders we promise a rewarding career progression: developing, customizing, and applying leading edge techniques across international markets, covering the full range of research applications across a wide range of industry sectors.

Reporting to the head of Brand & Media Marketing Science team, you have a strong background in statistics and complex analytics. You will be responsible for running analytic projects, with support/ supervision from senior staff where needed. You will make useful contributions to discussions with clients and researchers and will recommend appropriate methodologies to design analytic/ research programs which address the client’s marketing/business problems.

We are looking for someone with experience with applying a diverse range of advanced analytics to survey research and other data sources, with excellent knowledge of Regression (Logistic, Linear, Non-linear), Factor analysis, Mapping… Knowledge of other areas such as Bayesian Networks, econometric modelling, segmentation, data integration, marketing mix modelling.

We are looking for someone who is self-motivated, pro-active, creative, and eager to learn.

Responsibilities


Deliver analytics projects to a high quality that meet internal stakeholders’ and clients’ requirements
Maintain good working knowledge of statistical analysis techniques, both current and emerging.
Effectively manage own workload & be responsible for managing projects.
Maintain a broad and deep understanding of quantitative research techniques, to be able to mention appropriate solutions to client problems in a convincing way.
Develop an understanding of the possibilities and limitations of techniques and software packages.
Ensure high quality of all finished documents


Qualifications

Experience & Qualifications:


Bachelor or master’s degree in a field that emphasizes the learning of modelling, statistical or mathematical skills (PhD is a plus)
3-5+ years of work experience
Expert modelling skills and statistics knowledge (essential)
Expert statistical skills and knowledge of econometric techniques in:
survey/polling statistics (sampling, non-response adjustments, Bayesian statistics), and
econometric modelling (program evaluation, forecasting, economic theory, panel data), and/or
observational causal inference (potential outcomes, structural equation models, instrumental variables).
Experience in and strong interest in the following fields: pricing research, brand management, digital behavioral analysis, segmentation, media effectiveness, etc
Expert knowledge of analytics programming languages (e.g., Python, R) and the respective tool ecosystem (e.g., R-Studio Server, Spyder, Jupyter, POSIT Workbench)
Solid experience visualizing and communicating results of data analyses with the ability to think beyond the numbers while addressing real-world business problems

Desirable


Experience in open data sourcing (Google Trends, Social Mentions, etc.)
Experience using version control systems (e.g., Git)
Basic knowledge of Data Science such as Big Data Analytics (Machine Learning, Hadoop, Map Reduce, Hive, Spark, etc.)
Basic knowledge of cloud computing environments and tooling (AWS, Azure)
Basic SQL skills with regards to working with relational databases
Basic knowledge of programming in VBA


Soft Skills


Mathematical thinking, strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proven client-facing skills: translate and clearly communicate sophisticated analytical information to non-expert stakeholders and clients, able to deliver analytic insights in an impactful and meaningful way. Good at managing researcher expectations.
Proven project management skills: manage own and team time effectively and ensure all project deadlines are met, act to resolve conflicts between tasks
Good written skills, ability to write ability to help write reports and concise summary of findings (essential)
Good attention to detail – ensures all outputs delivered to clients/researchers are professionally presented and accurate.
Good interpersonal skills – treat others with respect, be cooperative, friendly and considerate of others. Be a good role model, help to build teamwork and team spirit.
Be well-organized, flexible, committed, pro-active, and creative
Is able to learn new methodologies and programming languages quickly.
Ease of communication in an English-speaking business environment


Additional Information

Open to other EU locations

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Are you passionate about energy, sustainability, and technology, with a drive to create impactful data solutions?

Flexcity, a leading European energy tech company within the Veolia Group is looking for a resourceful Data Scientist to join our Data team.

Job Description

As a Data Scientist, you will be the owner of data assets related to short-term electricity markets, for which Flexcity aims to deliver a best-in-class service. You will carry out quantitative analyses and design optimization solutions using Machine Learning or Linear Programming for our “Smart Grid” services. You will also collaborate with fellow Data Engineers and Developers to deploy these solutions into production.

By interacting with other Flexcity teams, you will gain hands-on experience in developing intelligent systems for both electricity markets (day-ahead, intraday, aFRR, …) and flexible assets (BESS, CHPs, solar parks, …). You will work with cutting-edge and innovative technologies used by Flexcity (Internet of Things, cloud-native development, …) in a fast-moving industry that actively contributes to the energy transition.

As Data Scientist, your time will be divided into:


Research and Development of ML and Optimization Algorithms - 60%
Contribute to all stages of the R&D lifecycle, including design, development, testing, deployment and monitoring of optimization algorithms
Delivering Quantitative Insights to Portfolio Teams - 30%
Use data-driven tools and skills to support colleague portfolio managers in their day-to-day work (market bidding, account management, …)
Data Architecture Improvement - 10%
Actively participate in initiatives to enhance the data stack, DevOps/MLOps practices and coding standards to foster a culture of continuous improvement
Qualifications

Experience


Master’s degree or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematical, Electricity or Energy Engineering, Mathematics or Physics with an excellent academic record
At least 4 years of professional experience working in a quantitative-savvy environment solving complex optimization problems using data


Hard Skills


Fluent in English
Mathematical modeling: Proficient in translating complex real-world systems into rigorous mathematical models
Python development: Proficient in writing Python scripts and building small Python prototypes (with libraries such as pandas, polars, requests, plotly, …)
SQL: Experience in understanding and writing complex SQL queries
Optimization: Experience with either Linear Optimization or Machine Learning methods
Nice to Have - experience with Linux and Git as DevOps tools
Nice to Have - experience with cloud platforms (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure, ...)


Soft Skills


Strong analytical thinking: Independently deconstruct complex quantitative problems and apply a systematic, methodical approach to implement effective solutions
Effective communication skills: Effectively convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, fostering collaboration and understanding across teams
Project management expertise: Organise and prioritise tasks, coordinate cross-functional efforts, and ensure timely delivery of solutions that align with project goals
A positive, pragmatic and professional attitude
Comfortable in a fast changing work environment, you can easily adapt
Nice to Have: an interest for the energy sector


Additional Information

Why Join Flexcity?

Impact Be part of our key Datal team, with a direct impact in the decarbonisation of our industry

Purpose Contribute concretely to a greener future, both in France and globally

Scale-up Work in an agile environment, getting structured and more efficient, but still with a large freedom and strategic decision making available at all levels of the company

Group Benefit from a close relationship with the Veolia group, a global leader in the ecological and energy transformation

Innovation Engage with cutting-edge energy technology and markets

Supported Get backing from dedicated central support teams in R&D, Product and Portfolio, in order to get you the best tools, training and sounding board to work in the best environment

Community Engage with a team spread across multiple countries, learning and innovating together. Connect with diverse teams across Europe through regular team-building events, both within Flexcity and Veolia

Training Develop your hard and soft skills with dedicated training made available, as well as strong learning curve within your position

Hybrid Experience international collaboration and flexible work schedules, including 2 work-from- home days

About Flexcity

Flexcity is a uniquely positioned energy technology company in the Internet of Energy sector. It is a leading demand response aggregator in Europe, rapidly growing and expanding to new regions. Flexcity’s core activity consists of supporting the power grid balance through the operation of its large portfolio of flexible fully-automated assets.

The Flexcity portfolio consists of a wide range of technologies such as batteries, eBoilers, CHPs, generators, wind farms, solar parks and large industrial processes.

As a provider of smart energy management services based on innovative smart grid technology, Flexcity applications focus on demand-side optimization and management (Demand Response, Load Shifting, etc.). Flexcity supports many industrial companies in reducing their overall electricity costs by providing demand-side management services based on innovative optimization and modelling software applications.

Flexcity is truly at the cutting edge of energy innovation. As a member of the team, you will contribute to a sustainable low-carbon energy sector.

As an inclusive company, Veolia is committed to diversity and gives equal consideration to all applications, without discrimination.

Why Join Flexcity?

Impact Be part of our key Datal team, with a direct impact in the decarbonisation of our industry

Purpose Contribute concretely to a greener future, both in France and globally

Scale-up Work in an agile environment, getting structured and more efficient, but still with a large freedom and strategic decision making available at all levels of the company

Group Benefit from a close relationship with the Veolia group, a global leader in the ecological and energy transformation

Innovation Engage with cutting-edge energy technology and markets

Supported Get backing from dedicated central support teams in R&D, Product and Portfolio, in order to get you the best tools, training and sounding board to work in the best environment

Community Engage with a team spread across multiple countries, learning and innovating together. Connect with diverse teams across Europe through regular team-building events, both within Flexcity and Veolia

Training Develop your hard and soft skills with dedicated training made available, as well as strong learning curve within your position

Hybrid Experience international collaboration and flexible work schedules, including 2 work-from- home days

About Flexcity

Flexcity is a uniquely positioned energy technology company in the Internet of Energy sector. It is a leading demand response aggregator in Europe, rapidly growing and expanding to new regions. Flexcity’s core activity consists of supporting the power grid balance through the operation of its large portfolio of flexible fully-automated assets.

The Flexcity portfolio consists of a wide range of technologies such as batteries, eBoilers, CHPs, generators, wind farms, solar parks and large industrial processes.

As a provider of smart energy management services based on innovative smart grid technology, Flexcity applications focus on demand-side optimization and management (Demand Response, Load Shifting, etc.). Flexcity supports many industrial companies in reducing their overall electricity costs by providing demand-side management services based on innovative optimization and modelling software applications.

Flexcity is truly at the cutting edge of energy innovation. As a member of the team, you will contribute to a sustainable low-carbon energy sector.

As an inclusive company, Veolia is committed to diversity and gives equal consideration to all applications, without discrimination.

Title: AI / ML Engineer
Description:
About

Bij Tensr vertalen we complexe data naar grensverleggende business oplossingen. Als onze nieuwe Data Consultant stap je in een dynamisch team en help je bedrijven voorop lopen in de wereld van AI. Ben jij de proactieve expert die onze klanten begeleidt in hun transitie naar een datagedreven toekomst? Dan zoeken wij jou! Je wordt onderdeel van een dynamisch team van data-experts en helpt bedrijven pionieren in de snel veranderende wereld van AI. Je speelt een cruciale rol in het ontwikkelen en implementeren van innovatieve dataoplossingen, van concept tot realisatie. Je communiceert met klanten om hun noden te begrijpen en begeleidt hen in hun transitie naar een AI- en datagedreven organisatie. Je gaat hands-on aan de slag met code, voornamelijk in Python, om robuuste dataoplossingen te ontwerpen en implementeren op het Google Cloud Platform. Je presenteert jouw oplossingen en inzichten aan zowel een technisch als niet-technisch publiek en toont zo de meerwaarde van AI en data. Je werkt samen met je team om schaalbare oplossingen te ontwerpen en uit te rollen op GCP. Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring in een rol als data expert, bijvoorbeeld als data scientist, data engineer of ML engineer. Je bent bedreven in Python. Je hebt een sterke kennis van (of bent bereid te leren over) het Google Cloud Platform, specifiek Vertex AI en BigQuery. Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatie- en presentatievaardigheden. Je bent vloeiend in het Engels en Nederlands (zowel gesproken als geschreven). Je bent zelfstandig, proactief en voelt je thuis in een omgeving met veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. Ervaring met computer vision-projecten is een grote plus. Wij zijn een jong bedrijf waar een geweldige sfeer en persoonlijke ontwikkeling centraal staan. We bieden een ondersteunende en inspirerende werkomgeving waarin je écht kan pionieren in de wereld van AI. Een competitief salaris, aangevuld met een uitgebreid pakket aan extralegale voordelen. Pionieren met de beste tech: De kans om te werken met de nieuwste en beste technologieën in de AI- en datawereld, met een focus op he... Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Apsida Life Science have partnered with a leading global Clinical Research Company to present the following role




Job Title: Data Scientist Associate

Location: EU – remote based (100% full time)

Duration: 8 months




Company Overview:




Apsida Life Science is currently partnering with a leading global clinical research organization (CRO) that provides comprehensive drug development and regulatory consulting services to the biopharmaceutical industry. With a strong focus on clinical trials, regulatory affairs, and real-world evidence, this company supports pharmaceutical and biotech companies in bringing innovative therapies to market efficiently and in compliance with international standards.




Responsibilities:

Managing overall data structure within the Data Dictionary system and supporting the project lead with the addition, modification and potential removal of objects, fields, picklists and attributes.
Managing definitions/metadata:
Supporting the definition of new metadata elements required in the Data Dictionary by collaborating with the data/process owners to obtain input.
Manage system activity within the Data Dictionary to ensure updates are progressed appropriately.
Strong Regulatory Business understanding: Knowledge of Regulatory CMC, Labelling and Reg Operations data domains
Ensure ongoing system compliance
Communication, training and documentation:
As required, define modifications made to the data dictionary in appropriate documentation.
Communicate with key stakeholders of key updates, risks, and decisions as appropriate.
Train data dictionary users on process and best practice as deemed necessary by the project lead.
Data quality checks: Execute data quality checks as defined by the maintenance process and ensure appropriate remediation/follow-up activity is performed.
Review the data types of fields to ensure they remain appropriate and up to date with the RIM system configuration.
Support the production of a data quality improvement report to close sub-workstream including assumptions, strategies addressed, decisions etc.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science; Computer Science or equivalent
Veeva Vault RIM and associated objects
Power BI
Tableau
Data management, regulatory metadata, knowledge of databases, understanding of data regulation
Data governance
The development and implementation of a data dictionary to provide data definitions, business rules, RACI, data dictionary consistency and report usage.




If you are interested in learning more, please reach out to Mufaro Mpofu at Apsida Life Science:




mufaro.mpofu@apsida.com




www.apsida.co.uK




Apsida Life Science is a specialist recruitment business based in London (UK), Redhill (UK), Boston (USA) & Pretoria (South Africa) that is dedicated to delivering the best talent to the Life Science industry. We believe there is a gap in the market for a cost effective, high quality and trusted recruitment service that puts the candidate journey at the heart of the recruitment process

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,300 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 18 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Are you passionate about AI and eager to drive innovation in a fast-paced, impact-driven environment? Do you have experience developing AI-powered applications and enjoy mentoring others? If so, we invite you to join Nexthink as an AI & ML Engineer!

As a key member of our AI team, you will design, develop, and deploy scalable AI solutions, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to enhance digital employee experiences for millions worldwide.

Responsibilities


Lead AI Development – Design and implement AI-powered products, with a strong focus on Agentic systems.
LLMs done right – Create evaluations and define metrics of success using cutting edge AI platforms.
MLOps - Implement and manage MLOps practices to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of models and in production environments.
Collaboration & Leadership – Work closely with software engineers, data scientists, and product teams to align AI capabilities with business needs.
Mentorship & Coaching – Guide and support junior AI engineers, fostering a culture of learning and knowledge sharing


Qualifications


BSc/MSc degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Hands-on experience in LLM-powered production applications.
Strong proficiency in Python and AI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, PyTorch).
Proven experience with AWS and cloud-based AI deployments.
Solid understanding of AI model fine-tuning, optimization, and evaluation.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and multi-agent AI architectures.
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs
Familiarity with MLOps best practices for deploying and monitoring AI models in production.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Eagerness to learn and adapt
Strong communication skills in English, capable of explaining complex AI concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders - we believe in learning by sharing.


If you’re excited about pushing the boundaries of AI and mentoring the next generation of engineers, we’d love to hear from you! Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply—we value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:


💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).
📍 Beautiful office with a view of Lake Geneva, conveniently located next to the Prilly-Malley train station
🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.
🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.
🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.
🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.
🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!
📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.
🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.


Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
CLEEVEN is a European consulting firm built around two core convictions:

The excellence of European engineers should drive global competitiveness.
Our human mission: to support our consultants in their personal and professional growth.




As part of a strategic data-driven transformation project for a major player in the pharmaceutical industry, we are recruiting a Data Scientist (M/F) to deliver impactful analytics, develop predictive models, and generate actionable insights across R&D, manufacturing, and commercial functions.




🎯 Role and Responsibilities

Collaborate with stakeholders across departments (clinical, regulatory, manufacturing, etc.) to translate business needs into data problems
Design and develop predictive models and statistical analyses to support decision-making in a GxP-compliant environment
Clean, structure, and enrich datasets from multiple sources (internal systems, sensors, third-party databases, etc.)
Apply machine learning and AI techniques (classification, clustering, regression, NLP) to real-world pharmaceutical challenges
Contribute to data product development: build reusable models, pipelines, and visual outputs
Partner with Data Engineers to ensure robust, scalable, and compliant deployment of data science solutions
Communicate results and recommendations clearly to non-technical stakeholders through reports, dashboards, and presentations




🧠 Required Skills

Proven experience as a Data Scientist, ideally in a regulated or scientific environment
Solid knowledge of machine learning, statistics, and data wrangling techniques
Proficiency in Python (pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, etc.), and tools like Jupyter, MLflow or similar
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, or Plotly Dash)
Good understanding of data governance and compliance in pharma (GxP, ALCOA+, FAIR principles) is a strong plus
Familiarity with pharma-specific domains like clinical trials, manufacturing processes, or real-world evidence is appreciated
Strong communication skills and ability to work cross-functionally




👤 Profile

Master's degree or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Statistics, or a related field
Minimum 2 years of experience in applied data science
Curious, rigorous, business-oriented, and able to explain complex models in simple terms
Fluent in English; German or French is a plus




See you soon,

Show more

Title: Junior AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,300 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 18 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

We are seeking a Junior AI Engineer with foundational knowledge in AI, GenAI, and Machine Learning. You will join one of our AI teams and assist them in prototyping, maturing, and shipping AI features to a production-ready level.

You are a pragmatic, results-driven engineer who is eager to learn and understands modern AI stacks but thinks in terms of software reliability, performance, and user impact. You focus on creating scalable, observable solutions that solve real-world problems for our customers.

Because the role is cross-functional, the ability to communicate complex concepts in simple ways is essential. You will collaborate with product, design, front-end, and infrastructure teams to bring delightful AI features to life.

Responsibilities

As part of the AI team at Nexthink, you will:


Assist in implementing new AI features with high-quality coding standards and automated test coverage.
Support solving the engineering challenges behind data collection, retrieval, evaluation, and inference at scale.
Help build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for AI components, ensuring safe, repeatable deployments.
Instrument robust online/offline evaluation metrics and dashboards to monitor quality in production.
Proactively propose new product capabilities or improvements based on user data and technology advances.
Stay current with the rapidly evolving AI engineering ecosystem and share knowledge with the Nexthink community.
Communicate effectively with (non-technical) stakeholders such as product managers and UX designers.


Qualifications


BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field
0-3 years of professional software-engineering experience, including internships or projects.
Basic experience in integrating with LLMs (e.g., Prompting, Evaluation, Observability).
Demonstrated interest in delivering AI-powered features that serve real users at scale (e.g., retrieval-augmented search, Generative AI assistants, predictive analytics).
Fluency in Python or at least one strongly-typed language (TypeScript or Java), with clean-code and testing discipline.
Understanding of cloud-native architectures (AWS or comparable), containerisation (Docker), and orchestration (Kubernetes / ECS).
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs.
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions.
Product mindset and empathy for end-users; able to translate fuzzy product requirements into incremental engineering plans.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English (spoken & written).


If you’re excited about joing one of the top companies working on AI and pushing the boundaries of AI we’d love to hear from you! Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply—we value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).

📍 Beautiful office with a view of Lake Geneva, conveniently located next to the Prilly-Malley train station

🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.

🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.

🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.

🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.

🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.

Please note that NOT all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.


Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,300 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 18 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

We are seeking a Junior AI Engineer with foundational knowledge in AI, GenAI, and Machine Learning. You will join one of our AI teams and assist them in prototyping, maturing, and shipping AI features to a production-ready level.

You are a pragmatic, results-driven engineer who is eager to learn and understands modern AI stacks but thinks in terms of software reliability, performance, and user impact. You focus on creating scalable, observable solutions that solve real-world problems for our customers.

Because the role is cross-functional, the ability to communicate complex concepts in simple ways is essential. You will collaborate with product, design, front-end, and infrastructure teams to bring delightful AI features to life.

Responsibilities

As part of the AI team at Nexthink, you will:

  • Assist in implementing new AI features with high-quality coding standards and automated test coverage.
  • Support solving the engineering challenges behind data collection, retrieval, evaluation, and inference at scale.
  • Help build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for AI components, ensuring safe, repeatable deployments.
  • Instrument robust online/offline evaluation metrics and dashboards to monitor quality in production.
  • Proactively propose new product capabilities or improvements based on user data and technology advances.
  • Stay current with the rapidly evolving AI engineering ecosystem and share knowledge with the Nexthink community.
  • Communicate effectively with (non-technical) stakeholders such as product managers and UX designers.

Qualifications

  • BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field
  • 0-3 years of professional software-engineering experience, including internships or projects.
  • Basic experience in integrating with LLMs (e.g., Prompting, Evaluation, Observability).
  • Demonstrated interest in delivering AI-powered features that serve real users at scale (e.g., retrieval-augmented search, Generative AI assistants, predictive analytics).
  • Fluency in Python or at least one strongly-typed language (TypeScript or Java), with clean-code and testing discipline.
  • Understanding of cloud-native architectures (AWS or comparable), containerisation (Docker), and orchestration (Kubernetes / ECS).
  • Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs.
  • Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions.
  • Product mindset and empathy for end-users; able to translate fuzzy product requirements into incremental engineering plans.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English (spoken & written).

If you’re excited about joing one of the top companies working on AI and pushing the boundaries of AI we’d love to hear from you! Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply—we value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).

📍 Beautiful office with a view of Lake Geneva, conveniently located next to the Prilly-Malley train station

🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.

🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.

🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.

🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.

🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.

Please note that NOT all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Cientista de Dados - São Paulo/SP
HTML:
About The Team

Sobre a Shô

Aqui na Shô, acreditamos que cada membro de nossa equipe é fundamental para o nosso sucesso, e que diversidade de perspectivas e vivências são essenciais para movimentar nosso negócio e impulsionar o nosso propósito de mudar o mundo para melhor.

Fazer parte do nosso time é a oportunidade de se desenvolver dentro de uma cultura de muita agilidade. Se você ama assumir grandes responsabilidades e fazer o que nunca foi feito, a Shô é seu lugar. Aqui você terá grandes desafios, trabalhará em colaboração com um time diverso e contribuirá para o futuro do e-commerce no Brasil, criamos impacto positivo na vida de milhões de pessoas.

Modelo de Trabalho

Adotamos um modelo de trabalho híbrido, esse modelo permite que as pessoas ajustem seu ambiente de trabalho de acordo com suas necessidades pessoais, ao mesmo tempo em que promove a colaboração e interação no escritório.

Qual será a sua missão

Você atuará no time de Business Development e será responsável por estruturar e automatizar processos de coleta, classificação, organização e análise de dados que apoiem decisões estratégicas em um ambiente de negócio altamente dinâmico e competitivo.

Buscamos alguém com perfil técnico e aplicado, que saiba construir soluções escaláveis, com forte raciocínio analítico e autonomia.

Job Description

Como será o seu dia a dia

  • Projetar e implementar pipelines robustos para processamento de dados em larga escala;
  • Participar ativamente da evolução da esteira de dados e modelos, com foco em escalabilidade, confiabilidade e impacto;
  • Colaborar com desenvolvedores, analistas de negócio e stakeholders de outras áreas, mantendo uma comunicação clara e objetiva;
  • Desenvolver dashboards e relatórios com dados processados, apoiando a geração de insights para o negócio;
  • Construir soluções com mentalidade DevOps e MLOps, utilizando automações, versionamento, CI/CD e monitoramento.

Requirements

O que você precisa para assumir o desafio

  • Experiência sólida com Python e bibliotecas de dados e machine learning (Pandas, Scikit-learn, etc.);
  • Vivência com PySpark ou ferramentas de processamento distribuído;
  • Experiência no tratamento e classificação de dados textuais não estruturados (ex: nomes e descrições de produtos, marcas, categorias), usando regex, Fuzzy Matching, embeddings ou LLMs;
  • Experiência com machine learning aplicado a problemas como classificação e segmentação;
  • Domínio de SQL, com experiência em modelagem de dados, otimização de consultas e organização de bases relacionais para consumo analítico;
  • Habilidade de colaborar em equipes multidisciplinares, com boa comunicação e visão de negócio;
  • Diferencial: domínio de frameworks como TensorFlow ou PyTorch;
  • Diferencial: experiência com sistemas de recomendação, otimização ou personalização em larga escala;
  • Diferencial: experiência com ingestão de dados externos e integração com fontes diversas (APIs, arquivos, dados públicos em escala);
  • Diferencial: familiaridade com ferramentas de orquestração como Airflow ou Kubeflow;
  • Diferencial: vivência em ambientes de e-commerce ou mercados com alta complexidade competitiva.

Benefícios

  • Assistência médica e odontológica, estendendo-se aos dependentes;
  • Parceira com Gympass e TotalPass;
  • Vale Refeição/Alimentação flexível;
  • Vale Transporte, Vale Mobilidade ou Estacionamento no local;
  • Benefício flexível;
  • Zenklub;
  • Bônus anual discricionário, atrelado à performance.

VEM FAZER HISTÓRIA COM A GENTE.

O QUE TE FAZ ÚNICO, NOS FAZ MELHORES! 🧡

Title: Cientista de Dados em People Analytics
HTML:
Job Description

Somos mais que uma máquina, somos pessoas que transformam e criam infinitas possibilidades.

Trabalhamos para simplificar e impulsionar negócios para todas as pessoas, oferecendo soluções financeiras inteligentes. Aqui, investimos em tecnologia, promovemos desenvolvimento e fomentamos a inovação para criar novos caminhos possíveis e gerar impacto positivo no mundo.

Na Cielo, a gente trabalha com autonomia para escrever nossa própria jornada, liberdade para ser quem a gente é, e a oportunidade de fazer acontecer. Somos um time que sonha no plural, oferecendo uma experiência completa e focando no bem-estar físico e mental de nossos mais de 6.000 colaboradores e suas famílias.

Acreditamos na inclusão e acolhimento de todas as pessoas, com suas singularidades e diversidade de vivências.

Bora realizar seus sonhos com a gente!

Conheça mais sobre a área Gerência de People Analytics:

A Gerência de People Analytics tem como missão ser a área de referência no mercado atuando através de dados na estratégia de pessoas na Cielo.

#VemPraCima #VemPraCielo

Responsibilities and assignments

Tem Lugar Para Você Nesse Propósito

  • Coletar, limpar, explorar e analisar dados de pessoas relacionados aos temas de RH, exemplos: recrutamento, performance, engajamento, turnover, dados de áreas comerciais, entre outros;
  • Desenvolver modelos estatísticos preditivos / prescritivos (ex.: propensão de rotatitividade; análise de produtividade, clustering de perfis de colaboradores, etc);
  • Criação de dashboards e visualizações de dados, garantir que esses dashboards respondam a perguntas estratégicas e estejam atualizados com dados confiáveis;
  • Elaborar estudos de correlação e casualidade (ex: impacto de turnover sobre performance);
  • Trabalhar com diferentes fontes de dados, de diversos sistemas, conhecimentos de automatizações de fluxo e garantir a qualidade dos dados/informações;
  • Estabelecer parcerias internas e com áreas de negócio com o intuito de resolver problemas complexos e propor soluções baseadas em dados.


Requirements And Qualifications

O que o #TimeCielo espera de você?

  • Formação superior completa em disciplina quantitativa, como Estatística, Matemática, Ciência de Dados, Economia, Finanças, Engenharia, Ciência da Computação e afins;
  • Sólida experiência como Especialista de Dados ou função semelhante envolvendo extração de dados, análise, modelagem estatística e visualização de dados;
  • Sólida experiência utilizando linguagens de consulta de dados e lógica de programação (exemplo: SQL, Python, R, entre outras linguagens);
  • Análise estatística prática com uma sólida compreensão e utilização dos fundamentos de análise descritiva, probabilidade, regressão, inferência, testes de hipóteses, modelos de otimização e métodos quantitativos e/ou machine learning;
  • Perfil analítico, raciocínio logico e de resolução de problemas, com grande capacidade de manipulação de dados estruturados e não estruturados, para simplificação de análises e processos;
  • Desenvolvimento de apresentações executivas para liderança e áreas internas da companhia.


Additional information

Por que viver infinitas possibilidades ao nosso lado?

  • Assistência Médica e Odontológica;
  • Remuneração Variável Anual (PPR);
  • Auxílio Refeição e Alimentação;
  • Modelo Híbrido;
  • Auxílio Trabalho Remoto;
  • Seguro de Vida;
  • Seguro residencial e automóvel;
  • Assistência funeral familiar;
  • Previdência Privada;
  • Canal de apoio à especialistas (nutrição, psicologia, ginecologia, etc);
  • Campanha de Vacinação;
  • Acesso à diversos cursos em nossa plataforma Educa;
  • Wellhub;
  • Fretado/vale-transporte ou estacionamento;
  • Programa de Gestação Saudável;
  • Licença Maternidade e Paternidade estendida;
  • Auxílio Creche;
  • Dress Code Flexível;
  • Horário Flexível;
  • Sexta-curta;
  • Almoço estendido (1h30).


Process stages

  • Registration
  • Triagem
  • Entrevista RH
  • Entrevista Gestor(a)
  • Hiring


Vem pro #TimeCIelo, onde seu sonho de transformação encontra infinitas possibilidades de se tornar realidade!

Somos mais que uma máquina, somos pessoas que sonham, transformam e criam infinitas possibilidades juntas.

Aqui a gente é movido por sonhos e, mais importante, por transformação! Por isso, nos empenhamos todos os dias para cumprir a nosso propósito de simplificar e impulsionar negócios para todas as pessoas, oferecendo soluções financeiras inteligentes e acessíveis que estão no dia a dia de quem movimenta o Brasil.

Para isso, Investimos fortemente em tecnologia, criamos um ambiente propenso ao desenvolvimento e fomentamos a inovação para aumentar cada vez mais a nossa capacidade de criar novos caminhos possíveis e gerar impacto positivo no mundo.

Trabalhar na Cielo é aprender na prática e construir uma carreira diariamente.

No nosso dia a dia, a gente trabalha com autonomia para escrever nossa própria jornada, liberdade para ser quem a gente é e a oportunidade de fazer acontecer.

Nós sonhamos no plural, acolhendo e ajudando a realizar os sonhos das mais de 6.000 pessoas que fazem parte do #TimeCielo. E, para torná-los realidade, a gente oferece uma experiência completa e inesquecível para o nosso time, focando no bem-estar físico e mental não apenas dos nossos colaboradores e colaboradoras, mas também de suas famílias.

Além disso, a gente acredita que a resposta para conseguir vislumbrar novos futuros está na inclusão e acolhimento de todas as pessoas, com suas singularidades e diversidade de vivências. Por isso, não importa qual seja o seu sonho – pra sua vida, sua carreira, pra deixar sua marca no mundo –, tem lugar pra ele aqui, junto com os nossos. Vem pra Cima, vem pra Cielo!

Title: Cientista de dados
Description:
Para o match perfeito acontecer precisa de PESSOAS, com as mais diversas experiências e pontos de vista, para que possamos continuar evoluindo enquanto empresa.

Por isso, aqui na SulAmérica, incentivamos a candidatura de pessoas de todas as raças/etnias, orientações sexuais, identidades de gênero, gerações, com ou sem deficiência, para todas as nossas vagas. Afinal, as nossas diferenças é o que nos complementam!

#LGBTI+ #PessoasNegras #PcD #50+ #Gerações #PessoasComDeficiência




Como será o seu dia a dia nessa área:

Tratar e analisar grandes conjuntos de dados para identificar padrões, tendências e anomalias que possam indicar atividades de fraude ou abuso.

Criar modelos estatísticos e algoritmos para a detecção de fraude/abusos ou má utilização do plano.

Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com a equipe de combate à fraude para compartilhar informações, relatar descobertas e auxiliar em investigações.

Apresentar resultados por meio de visualizações de dados, como gráficos / dashboards, para tornar as informações acessíveis e compreensíveis para a equipe de combate à fraude.

Garantir a segurança e a privacidade dos dados utilizados nas análises, cumprindo os regulamentos de proteção de dados.

Documentar descobertas e resultados de análises em relatórios que podem ser usados para investigações, auditorias e relatórios de status.

Entre outras atividades.




Requisitos necessários para ser Cientista de dados na #SulA:

Graduação completa equivalente em Estatística, Matemática, Economia, Ciência da Computação, Engenharia ou campo relacionado.

Domínio com linguagens de programação usadas na análise de dados, como Python e R.

Conhecimento em SQL e experiência com Google BigQuery.

Ter atuado com ciência de dados ou campo similar.




Será um diferencial se você tiver:

Conhecimento em seguradoras.




Local de trabalho: São Paulo – Região da Avenida Paulista




O que a SulA vai te proporcionar?

Além de um ambiente de inovação e aberto a experimentação:
Salário competitivo com o mercado;
Vale Refeição e Alimentação - para matar aquela fome;
Assistência Média e Odontológica (extensível a dependentes) - Claro, da SulAmérica né!
Seguro de vida;
Auxílio Creche para papais e mamães;
Previdência Privada com uma ajudinha da SulA;
Seguro de Vida.

A SulAmérica é uma empresa em transformação, com DNA inovador e sempre preocupada em atender as necessidades dos seus clientes com soluções e produtos encantadores. Se identificou? Então vem com a gente e fazer parte desse time #sanguelaranja 🧡🚀




Buscamos pessoas que gostem de desafios e:

Sejam colaborativas;
Tenham foco no resultado e centralidade em nossos(as) clientes;
Saibam se adaptar aos diferentes desafios do dia a dia;
Que tenha sempre em mente o inconformismo, propondo soluções inovadoras.




O que oferecemos para você:




Salário competitivo com o mercado.
Vale Refeição e Alimentação.
Assistência Médica e Odontológica (extensiva a dependentes) da SulAmérica!
Seguro de vida SulAmérica.
Auxílio Creche /Babá.
Previdência Privada com contrapartida SulAmérica.
Programa de Participação nos Resultados.
Vale transporte.

Se identificou? Então, vem fazer parte do time #SangueLaranja 🧡🚀




Sobre nós:

Há mais de 129 anos, a SulAmérica tem como missão melhorar a vida das pessoas, oferecendo apoio, segurança e autonomia em todos os momentos. Atendemos 6.8 milhões de clientes por meio de nossos produtos e serviços de Saúde, Odonto, Vida, Previdência e Investimentos. Para tornar isso possível, contamos com o engajamento e a dedicação de mais de 4 mil colaboradores(as) comprometidos(as) com o nosso propósito.




Acreditamos que por meio da inclusão e da diversidade construímos um ambiente seguro e de pertencimento que valoriza e respeita as pessoas integralmente. Assim, incentivamos a candidatura de pessoas com deficiência, de diferentes raças e etnias, gêneros, orientações sexuais, identidades de gênero e gerações para todas as nossas vagas.




Quer saber mais sobre nós?

Acompanhe a gente aqui no LinkedIn e no Instagram: @sulamerica

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Position

Data Scientist

Job Responsibilities

The position is based in our HQ in Rome and part of the Global team.

The Data Scientist's mission is to empower Fendi with data-driven insights that fuel strategic decision-making, enhance customer understanding, and drive business growth. By leveraging analytical expertise and a deep understanding of the business, the Data Scientist's will identify opportunities for optimization, improve operational efficiency, and contribute to Fendi's continued success in the luxury fashion market.

As part of the LVMH Group, this role also involves collaborating and interfacing with other entities within the group, providing a broader perspective and exposure to a diverse range of business challenges and opportunities.

Main Responsibilities


Proficiency in machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms with a strong understanding of their practical applications.
Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models to address complex business challenges, optimize operational efficiency, and deliver actionable strategic insights.
Expertise in analyzing large, diverse datasets using advanced statistical and AI techniques to identify key trends, patterns, and correlations, transforming these insights into clear, data-driven recommendations for business stakeholders.
Proven experience working with customer and sales data, particularly within a retail/consumer environment, to drive targeted business outcomes.
Expertise in data collection, cleansing, and comprehensive analysis of large datasets from various sources, including customer, sales, and operational data repositories.
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to address specific business inquiries and support informed decision-making processes across the organization.
Measure the impact and effectiveness of strategic initiatives and marketing campaigns using appropriate metrics and rigorous statistical methodologies.
Measure the results of initiatives and campaigns using appropriate metrics and statistical methods.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into clear, well-defined data analysis projects.
Communicate complex findings, insights, and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.
Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing data-driven insights and support for key business initiatives.
Manage relationships with data vendors, ensuring service level agreements (SLAs) are met and data quality is maintained.


Profile


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in a data scientist role.
Proficiency in Python and R programming languages.
Experience with data visualization tools, mainly Power BI.
Preferably experience with Dataiku.
Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases.
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Knowledge of statistical modelling techniques. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and perform under pressure in a fast-paced.
Evidence of successful delivery of data driven analysis and recommendations to drive forward business performance.
Critical thinking and attention to detail, extremely organized and high attention to luxury and detail
Demonstrated interest in keeping up with emerging technologies and the data trend.
Fluency in English and Italian are a mus


Additional Information

LVMH is committed to non-discrimination and respect of each person’s singularities. We recognize and recruit all types of talent
Show more
HTML:
Position

Data Scientist

Job Responsibilities

The position is based in our HQ in Rome and part of the Global team.

The Data Scientist's mission is to empower Fendi with data-driven insights that fuel strategic decision-making, enhance customer understanding, and drive business growth. By leveraging analytical expertise and a deep understanding of the business, the Data Scientist's will identify opportunities for optimization, improve operational efficiency, and contribute to Fendi's continued success in the luxury fashion market.

As part of the LVMH Group, this role also involves collaborating and interfacing with other entities within the group, providing a broader perspective and exposure to a diverse range of business challenges and opportunities.

Main Responsibilities

  • Proficiency in machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms with a strong understanding of their practical applications.
  • Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models to address complex business challenges, optimize operational efficiency, and deliver actionable strategic insights.
  • Expertise in analyzing large, diverse datasets using advanced statistical and AI techniques to identify key trends, patterns, and correlations, transforming these insights into clear, data-driven recommendations for business stakeholders.
  • Proven experience working with customer and sales data, particularly within a retail/consumer environment, to drive targeted business outcomes.
  • Expertise in data collection, cleansing, and comprehensive analysis of large datasets from various sources, including customer, sales, and operational data repositories.
  • Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to address specific business inquiries and support informed decision-making processes across the organization.
  • Measure the impact and effectiveness of strategic initiatives and marketing campaigns using appropriate metrics and rigorous statistical methodologies.
  • Measure the results of initiatives and campaigns using appropriate metrics and statistical methods.
  • Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into clear, well-defined data analysis projects.
  • Communicate complex findings, insights, and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.
  • Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing data-driven insights and support for key business initiatives.
  • Manage relationships with data vendors, ensuring service level agreements (SLAs) are met and data quality is maintained.

Profile

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
  • 3-5 years of experience in a data scientist role.
  • Proficiency in Python and R programming languages.
  • Experience with data visualization tools, mainly Power BI.
  • Preferably experience with Dataiku.
  • Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases.
  • Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
  • Knowledge of statistical modelling techniques. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team and perform under pressure in a fast-paced.
  • Evidence of successful delivery of data driven analysis and recommendations to drive forward business performance.
  • Critical thinking and attention to detail, extremely organized and high attention to luxury and detail
  • Demonstrated interest in keeping up with emerging technologies and the data trend.
  • Fluency in English and Italian are a mus

Additional Information

LVMH is committed to non-discrimination and respect of each person’s singularities. We recognize and recruit all types of talent

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🏥 Data Scientist – Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS | Ospedale Isola Tiberina, Rome




For the third year running, Newsweek lists Gemelli among the world’s 40 best hospitals—the only Italian institution in that elite group. As an IRCCS, we lead research in personalized medicine and innovative biotechnologies. Backed by the PNRR grant (MCNT2-2023-12378319), we’re expanding our data-driven research team.




🔍 What you’ll do

Turn rich clinical datasets into actionable insight—building statistical and machine-learning models that predict treatment outcomes, patient responses, and disease progression. Work side-by-side with physicians to translate algorithms into better bedside decisions.




What you bring
MSc/PhD in Data Science, Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, or related field
Fluency in Python or R for data wrangling, stats, and ML
Solid grasp of advanced statistical methods, machine-learning techniques, and data-mining workflows
A collaborative mindset that thrives in multidisciplinary teams




What we offer
12-month fixed-term contract with competitive salary
Hybrid, flexible work in new co-working spaces designed for collaboration
Personalised learning paths, conferences, and mentorship
A diverse, inclusive environment where your ideas can shape tomorrow’s healthcare




📧 Send your CV to francesco.pesce@fbf-isola.it




#DataScience #MachineLearning #AIinHealth #Healthcare #PNRR #Gemelli #IRCCS #Rome #Hiring #ClinicalResearch

Title: Data Scientist/ML Engineer
Description:
Ciao, talento del tech! 🌟

Siamo MatchGuru, piacere di conoscerti!




Ci presentiamo, come è giusto che sia 🤝

MatchGuru è più di una piattaforma: è l'epicentro dove talenti e aziende si scoprono, capiscono e incontrano.

Con le nostre soluzioni tecnologiche proprietarie, acceleriamo ed efficientiamo il processo di selezione, liberandolo da rallentamenti ed errori. Questo ci rende una vera e propria guida sia per i talenti, che accompagniamo verso le opportunità più affini alle proprie caratteristiche e aspettative, sia per l’azienda, che aiutiamo a scovare i candidati perfetti prima di ogni altri competitor.




Come farai match con la tua azienda ideale💘

Candidandoti a uno degli annunci delle nostre Talent Acquisition, ti collegherai alla piattaforma MatchGuru, dove potrai creare il tuo profilo da zero, inserire le tue competenze tecniche e raccontarci qual è l’azienda in cui ti piacerebbe lavorare. Una volta che ci avrai detto tutto di te, il nostro team di recruiter ti contatterà per presentarti la tua azienda ideale. Sarà un colpo di fulmine?




⭐ L'opportunità

Posizione: Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer
Seniority: 2+ anni di esperienza
Modalità di lavoro: Ibrido su Roma
Contratto: Collaborazione con Partita IVA




💡 Potresti fare match con questa posizione se:

Hai una laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Statistica o campi affini
Hai forti competenze in Python e conosci bene librerie ML (scikit-learn, XGBoost, PyTorch) e strumenti di data science (pandas, NumPy)
Hai una solida comprensione dei mercati finanziari e delle dinamiche di trading
Hai un'ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese




💼 Le tue responsabilità includeranno:

Sviluppare, testare e ridefinire modelli predittivi
Creare pipeline di machine learning
Tradurre ipotesi di investimento in feature scalabili insieme al team prodotto
Analizzare rischi e comportamenti delle strategie in diversi contesti di mercato




🌟 Nice to have:

Hai contribuito a progetti open source in ambito trading o machine learning




💶 Ma andiamo al sodo: ecco cosa ti offriamo

Collaborazione in P.IVA
Opportunità di crescita rapida in una startup statunitense in forte espansione
Ambiente di lavoro dinamico, giovane e internazionale
Offsite internazionali




Se pensi di essere il match perfetto per questa opportunità o conosci qualcuno che potrebbe esserlo, candidati subito oppure contattaci! 📩




Proviamo a matchare? 🚀




N.B. Ricorda di esplicitare nel CV il tuo consenso al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi del D.LGS. 196/03. La ricerca è rivolta a persone di ogni genere, nel rispetto della normativa vigente (L.903/77).

Title: Junior Data Scientist | Big Data & Advanced Analytics (Milano-Roma)
Description:
Junior Data Scientist – Big Data & Advanced Analytics




Sede: Milano - Roma (Ibrido)

Azienda: Be Management Consulting

Settore: Consulenza direzionale e IT per il settore bancario




CHI CERCHIAMO

Siamo alla ricerca di un Junior Data Scientist con una forte passione per l’Intelligenza Artificiale e il Machine Learning. Cerchiamo una persona curiosa, proattiva e desiderosa di mettersi in gioco, imparare sul campo e crescere rapidamente in un ambiente dinamico e innovativo.




COSA FARAI

Supporto all’analisi e modellazione dati: collaborerai allo sviluppo di modelli di Machine Learning e AI, affiancato da profili più senior.
Sviluppo algoritmi e sperimentazione: parteciperai all’implementazione per l’elaborazione e l’interpretazione dei dati, contribuendo alla trasformazione digitale delle aziende.
Big Data & Advanced Analytics: contribuirai all’analisi di dataset complessi nel settore finanziario.
Data Visualization: realizzerai dashboard e report sotto la guida di figure esperte per rendere i dati facilmente comprensibili agli stakeholder.
Formazione continua: imparerai a lavorare in team multidisciplinari, sperimentando tecnologie e approcci innovativi.




REQUISITI

Formazione: Laurea Magistrale o PHD in Statistica, Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria o discipline affini.
Esperienza: 0–2 anni in ambito Data Science / AI / Advanced Analytics (anche tirocini o progetti universitari rilevanti).
Competenze tecniche Conoscenza di Python (o alternativamente R, Matlab, SPSS, SAS), SQL e strumenti di analisi statistica. Familiarità con ambienti cloud (preferibilmente Azure).
Soft Skills: Forte motivazione, spirito di iniziativa, voglia di imparare, capacità di lavorare in team e affrontare nuove sfide.
Lingue: Ottima conoscenza dell’inglese scritto e parlato.
Tool: Interesse per strumenti di Data Visualization e BI







CHI SIAMO

Be | Shaping the Future, parte del gruppo Engineering, è tra i principali player in ambito Management Consulting e ICT Solutions. Forniamo servizi di Business Advisory, Information Technology e Digital Engagement, supportando primarie istituzioni finanziarie e industriali nelle loro sfide di trasformazione digitale. Con circa 2.000 dipendenti e una presenza internazionale, il Gruppo è un punto di riferimento nel settore Financial Services.

Be Management Consulting è la società del Gruppo Be | Shaping the Future specializzata in Business Advisory. Supportiamo i nostri clienti nella gestione di progetti complessi con un approccio tailor-made, combinando competenze specialistiche e capacità di orchestrare soluzioni end-to-end.




COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Flessibilità: Sede a Milano con ampia possibilità di smart working.
Formazione continua: Accesso a corsi interni ed esterni per lo sviluppo professionale.
Feedback & crescita: Valutazioni periodiche basate sul merito e contatto diretto con il senior management.
Percorso di carriera dinamico: Crescita rapida in un ambiente giovane e imprenditoriale.




Durante il colloquio risponderemo a tutte le tue curiosità su Be e su come puoi fare la differenza.

Let’s shape our future together!




“I dati che Lei ci fornirà saranno raccolti dalla società Be Shaping the Future S.p.A. in quanto esclusivamente finalizzati alle attività di ricerca e selezione del personale, per posizioni aperte attuali e future, per un potenziale inserimento all’ interno delle singole società del gruppo Be: Be Shaping the Future S.p.A., Be Shaping the Future Management Consulting S.p. A., Be Shaping the Future Corporate Services S.p.A., Be Shaping the Future DigiTech Solutions S.p.A., IQUII Srl, Tesla Consulting Srl, Dream Of Ordinary Madness Entertainment S.r.l, Be Your Essence S.r.L , Be Poland Think, Solve & Execute Sp. z o. o., iBe Think Solve, Execute Ltd., targit GmbH, Be Think, Solve, Execute RO s.r.l., Be Ukraine Think, Solve, Execute LLC., nonché di ogni altra società appartenente al Gruppo Be. Per quanto non espressamente previsto in questo annuncio si rinvia all’Informativa privacy di Gruppo https://www.be-tse.it/it/ della quale l’interessato dichiara di aver preso visione condividendone il contenuto”.
