  • Develop responsive and cross-browser compatible web applications
  • Collaborate with UX designers to optimize user experiences
  • Work within Agile frameworks (Scrum, Kanban)
  • Utilize test-driven development practices
  • Manage source control systems adhering to best practices
  • Communicate effectively with team members across different time zones

Education

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor/Master's degree in Computer Science or related field

Technical Skills

  • Proficiency in JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3
  • Experience with functional programming
  • Expertise in at least one of: Angular or React
  • Familiarity with test-driven development tools and practices
  • Knowledge of source control systems and best practices

Methodologies

  • Experience with Agile frameworks (Scrum, Kanban)

Soft Skills

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills for effective teamwork

Language

  • Fluency in English (both written and spoken)

Legal

  • Valid EU visa or work permit

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience working in distributed teams
  • Knowledge of additional front-end frameworks or libraries
  • Understanding of UX/UI principles

Employment Details

  • Contract Type: Full-time, permanent
  • Working Mode: Hybrid

Learn more at iongroup.com.

Important Notes

According to the Italian Law (L.68/99) please note that candidates from the disability list will be given priority.

Please do not apply if you don’t currently have the legal right to work in Italy, or if that right is just about to expire, or if that right has restrictions imposed which would prevent you from undertaking a full-time employment contract.

Due to the high volume of applications, only those candidates that meet the required criteria for selection will be contacted.

Title: Bioinformatics Scientist - Fixed Term
Description:
Nouscom is a private clinical stage immuno-oncology company developing next-generation, off-the-shelf and personalized cancer vaccines. Our proprietary viral vector platform has the capacity to encode for large payloads of neoantigens or other immunomodulators and is clinically demonstrated to safely and potently harness the power of the immune system.




We are seeking a motivated and skilled Bioinformatics Scientist with 1 to 5 years of experience in computer science, software/program design, and informatics technologies to join our interdisciplinary team. This role will focus on designing and developing computational pipelines, analyzing complex biological data, and supporting scientific research through innovative informatics solutions.




The Bioinformatic Scientist will play a key role in the development of new algorithms to identify and select personalized as well as shared antigens for development of either personalized or off-the-shelf cancer vaccines. He/she will contribute to continuous improvement of the discovery pipeline performance by integrating newly acquired in-house and public data. He/she will develop robust analysis pipelines that can be applied in both research and clinical settings. As a part of the role, he/she will design vaccines following our in-house pipeline during clinical trial phases. Among other duties, he/she will liaise with external collaborators/service providers (e.g. NGS related) and will interact with IT to maintain scientific computing infrastructure. The Bioinformatics scientist will report directly to the Senior Bioinformatic Scientist of the Team.




Key responsibilities:




Design, implement, and optimize bioinformatics pipelines for genomic, transcriptomic, proteomic, or clinical data analysis




Develop and maintain scalable software tools and applications tailored to biological datasets




Collaborate with biologists, clinicians, and data scientists to support experimental design and data interpretation




Integrate data from public and proprietary sources to support research projects and product development




Maintain clear documentation of code, workflows, and results to ensure reproducibility and compliance with data standards




Troubleshoot and improve existing bioinformatics workflows for accuracy, performance, and automation




Present findings and technical approaches to stakeholders and cross-functional teams




Job requirements:




Ph.D. in Bioinformatics / Computer Science / Computational Biology & Data Sciences




A degree in scientific disciplines (Biotechnology, Chemistry, Biology, Pharmacy, or similar fields)




Strong programming and data science skills




1-5 years of relevant experience in bioinformatics, software development, or data science roles




Skilled in programming languages such as Python, R, Java, C++ as well as bioinformatics software and databases




Strong knowledge of algorithm development, data structures, and software design principles




Experience working in Unix/Linux environments and with version control systems (e.g., Git)




Familiarity with biological databases (e.g., NCBI, Ensembl) and tools (e.g., BLAST, GATK, BWA)




Understanding of next-generation sequencing (NGS) technologies and data formats (FASTQ, BAM, VCF)




Proficient in statistical analysis, machine learning, and data visualization




Hands-on experience in data analysis workflows of sequencing data




Capability to development of novel innovative algorithms/analyses and the adoption of available open source or licensed solutions




A team player in a multidisciplinary environment




Outstanding interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills




Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills




Offer:




This position provides the opportunity to contribute to the development of advanced therapies in a dynamic and innovative environment, with opportunities for professional growth and continuous training.




As part of a small high growth business you will get the opportunity to be involved in many different areas and our rapid growth trajectory means you will have the opportunity to grow with us.




Nouscom is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all individuals. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.

We are seeking a motivated and skilled Bioinformatics Scientist with 1 to 5 years of experience in computer science, software/program design, and informatics technologies to join our interdisciplinary team. The Bioinformatic Scientist will play a key role in the development of new algorithms to identify and select personalized as well as shared antigens for development of either personalized or off-the-shelf cancer vaccines.   • Strong programming and data science skills

This position provides the opportunity to contribute to the development of advanced therapies in a dynamic and innovative environment, with opportunities for professional growth and continuous training.


As part of a small high growth business you will get the opportunity to be involved in many different areas and our rapid growth trajectory means you will have the opportunity to grow with us.


Nouscom is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all individuals. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.

Title: Programmatore REACT
HTML:
Il Gruppo EIES, composto da Energent, I&M, Enway e Skienda, è una realtà di consulenza e di prodotto consolidata nel mercato delle soluzioni e dei servizi ICT.


Per ampliamento dell’organico ricerchiamo la figura di un Programmatore REACT con almeno 3 anni di esperienza maturata nel ruolo.


Cosa offriamo:

  • Ambiente di lavoro dinamico ed orientato alla crescita professionale;
  • Certification Program: il programma formativo di EIES Group pensato per supportare e valorizzare la crescita professionale in un’ottica di miglioramento continuo;
  • Birthday Off: un giorno di riposo extra per staccare dal lavoro e festeggiare il tuo compleanno come meriti!
  • Buoni pasto;
  • Piattaforma di e-commerce con scontistiche riservate ai dipendenti;
  • Confronto all'interno di un team strutturato e coeso;
  • Inquadramento contrattuale e retributivo commisurato alla Seniority;
  • Programma di Buddy: un collega dedicato che ti affiancherà nel periodo iniziale per facilitare l'integrazione nel team e supportarti nell'apprendimento dei processi aziendali;


Sede di lavoro: Roma

Modalità di lavoro: ibrido, 3 volte a settimana in presenza, zona Ponte Galeria nuova fiera di Roma.


Chi siamo?

Il Gruppo EIES rappresenta l'alleanza strategica di quattro aziende italiane leader nel settore informatico, unite per offrire al mercato una copertura completa, integrata e sinergica.

Composto da Energent, I&M Consulting, Enway e Skienda, il Gruppo è una realtà che eroga consulenza, progettualità e servizi in ambito ICT, fornendo soluzioni ad alto valore aggiunto per i propri clienti. Con sedi a Roma, Napoli e Milano, operiamo in settori come Finance, Insurance, Telco, Energy e Pubblica Amministrazione, collaborando con aziende di primaria importanza ed i principali System Integrator.

Il gruppo è organizzato in practices tematiche afferenti a diverse aree di competenza: Infrastrutture & Security, Application Modernization & Cloud Transformation, Data Science e Artificial Intelligence e Consulting. Inoltre, il Gruppo dispone di due Factory specializzate in Sviluppo Software e Dati che lavorano sinergicamente per progettare soluzioni innovative, affidabili e personalizzate e per la delivery di progetti chiavi in mano.

Unirsi al Gruppo EIES significa entrare a far parte di una realtà dinamica e all'avanguardia, dove il contributo di ciascuno viene valorizzato e l'innovazione è al centro di ciò che facciamo. Se cerchi una sfida stimolante in un ambiente in continua evoluzione, il nostro gruppo è il posto giusto per te.

Title: New Graduate - Computer Vision/Robotics Engineer
Description:
Vorresti iniziare la tua carriera professionale in un contesto multinazionale, altamente specializzato ed innovativo?

La Service Line Advacend Techologies & Innovation è alla ricerca di un Computer Vision Engineer per ampliare e rafforzare il proprio team.

La persona selezionata avrà l'opportunità di lavorare su progetti innovativi e stimolanti in un ambiente altamente internazionale nell'ambito Computer Vision e Robotica e di accrescere le competenze in questo ambito grazie all'affiancamento con professionisti nel settore.

Non è indispensabile avere esperienze lavorative pregresse, cerchiamo persone curiose e motivate che abbiano voglia di imparare e crescere insieme al team.

Responsabilità


Partecipazione a riunioni di natura tecnica e ai meeting progettuali
Partecipazione allo sviluppo di componenti software legate al mondo della computer vision e della robotica
Contribuzione alle fasi di progettazione e implementazione
Preparazione di reportistica e documentazione



Requisiti


Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica, Data Science (è gradita una esperienza rilevante nel campo della AI o Robotica)
Buona conoscenza dei concetti di Intelligenza Artificiale, in particolare per quanto riguarda le tecniche di Computer Vision
Buona conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione come C/C++, Python, e conoscenza del framework ROS
Ottima padronanza della lingua inglese
Forte passione per l'innovazione e il mondo della tecnologia
Approccio proattivo e curioso
Predisposizione al lavoro di gruppo
Orientamento al risultato.



Sedi di Lavoro: Milano, Roma - Modalità di lavoro ibrida

Come società Global Top Employer abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, l’ascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra priorità.

Crediamo nel talento e nell’evoluzione professionale, supportati da: formazione continua, programmi di apprendimento avanzati e piani di crescita personalizzati.

Facciamo parte di NTT Group, che investe oltre 3,6 miliardi di dollari ogni anno in ricerca e sviluppo per aiutare organizzazioni e società a muoversi con fiducia e sostenibilità verso il futuro digitale.

Siamo presenti in Italia con oltre 6000 dipendenti a Milano, Roma, Torino, Genova, Bologna, Treviso, Pisa, Napoli, Cosenza, Bari e Salerno.

Title: Junior - Cloud Strategy
Description:
Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team Cloud Strategy & Architecture di Deloitte Engineering nella sede di Milano/Roma, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Il team di Cloud Strategy & Architecture si impegna ogni giorno a guidare i clienti nello sviluppo ed esecuzione di strategie cloud multi-dimensionali che considerano le piattaforme, le architetture, la sicurezza, gli aspetti organizzativi e finanziari derivanti dall’adozione delle soluzioni Cloud, supportando i propri clienti nella definizione della cloud strategy e nel disegno dell’architettura target da implementare.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior sarà inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:


Supportare i propri clienti nella definizione della cloud strategy, nel disegno dell’architettura target da implementare, nella migrazione dei workloads in cloud, nel cloud native application development, fino alla governance delle soluzioni Cloud implementate.
Raccogliere e analizzare i dati a supporto dell’elaborazione di soluzioni per i clienti
Possedere un forte orientamento al team working, alla collaborazione e al supporto dei colleghi, mantenendo sempre un approccio positivo alle situazioni
Partecipare ad importanti progetti internazionali End to End lavorando sulla definizione della cloud strategy delle aziende clienti


Winning Requirements


Laurea triennale/specialistica (conseguita o in corso di completamento) in Ingegneria o discipline tecnico/scientifiche affini
Forte propensione/interesse per il Cloud e per le nuove tecnologie emergenti
Gradita la conoscenza di piattaforme cloud come AWS, Azure e GCP
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta e parlata
Ottime capacità analitiche, precisione, autonomia organizzativa e spiccato orientamento al raggiungimento dei risultati
Disponibilità a trasferte


To Make an Impact that Matters

Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in più di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.

In Italia, Deloitte è presente in 24 città con circa 13.400 persone che assistono i clienti offrendo servizi di Audit & Assurance, Technology & Transformantion, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory e Tax & Legal.

In qualità di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della società di oggi. WorldImpact è il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l’ambiente e le comunità in cui operiamo.

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che – in collaborazione con istituzioni, realtà del terzo settore, università e altri soggetti – hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.
Show more

Title: Jupyter Specialist.
Description:
Job Description

DXC Technology Italy is looking for a Jupyter Specialist.

Responsibilities


Perform analysis and boost the performance
Install the add-on and tool upgrade
Share reproducible and documented code and analyses


Requirements


Previous experience on the role and deep knowledge of Jypyter configuration and administration including the installation and upgrade of Jupyter components
Proficiency in Python, R, Linux
Strong problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills
Ability to communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders


Work locations: Rome with remote work possibilty

At DXC Technology, we believe strong connections and community are key to our success. Our work model prioritizes in-person collaboration while offering flexibility to support wellbeing, productivity, individual work styles, and life circumstances. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive.

Recruitment fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or through unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. These emails may request recipients to provide personal information or to make payments as part of their illegitimate recruiting process. DXC does not make offers of employment via social media networks and DXC never asks for any money or payments from applicants at any point in the recruitment process, nor ask a job seeker to purchase IT or other equipment on our behalf. More information on employment scams is available here.

Title: Research Scientist Display Technologies
Description:
Research Scientist

Display Technologies Unit

IRBM is a scientific contract research organization (CRO) that stands at the forefront of drug discovery, leveraging a single, unified research facility, located in Pomezia (Rome), Italy, to accelerate team-based breakthroughs and improve efficiencies from initial concept to pre-clinical candidate.

With a history of contributing to several approved drugs, and its own internal pipeline of oncology and other therapeutic assets, IRBM is powered by deep collaborations and decades of expertise from leading global institutions. Our comprehensive in-house capabilities assist partners in achieving key milestones and progressing towards clinical readiness, positioning IRBM as a major player in driving innovation in the pharmaceutical and biotech fields.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated PhD Scientist with expertise in drug discovery, Phage Display, and mRNA display technologies to join our Display Technologies team. The successful candidate will contribute to the identification and development of novel therapeutic agents and play a key role in our drug discovery efforts and will be responsible for driving the execution and expansion of the state-of art of new Display methodologies. Candidates with prior research experience abroad will be given priority.

Key Responsibilities

Design and execute experiments using Phage Display and mRNA display technologies to identify high-affinity peptides and antibodies.
Conduct bio-panning and selection rounds to enrich for target-specific clones.
Analyze sequencing data to identify unique peptide and antibody sequences.
Develop and optimize assays for binding, internalization, and functional activity of identified candidates.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate findings into broader drug discovery projects.
Maintain detailed and accurate records of experimental procedures and results.
Present research findings at internal and external meetings and conferences.
Stay current with advancements in drug discovery, Phage Display, and mRNA display technologies.

Qualifications & Requirements:

PhD in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Biotechnology, or a related field.
Extensive experience with drug discovery, Phage Display, and mRNA display technologies.
Proficiency in molecular biology techniques such as PCR, cloning, and sequencing.
Strong background in protein-protein interactions and assay development.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Ability to coordinate multiple projects.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Proficient in English.
Experience with high-throughput screening (HTS) methods is a plus.

The position is based in Pomezia (RM).

During the job interview, we will evaluate each candidate’s experience, and the job offer will be commensurate.

We thank all applicants for their interest. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

IRBM considers all qualified applicants without discrimination, including on the basis of race, gender, age, disability, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, or other protected classes. We nurture an inclusive culture where everyone can show their full potential and enjoy a fulfilling career.

IRBM considers all qualified applicants without discrimination, including on the basis of race, gender, age, disability, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, or other protected classes. We nurture an inclusive culture where everyone can show their full potential and enjoy a fulfilling career.

Title: Full-stack Developer
Description:
CHI SIAMO

Adentis Italia è un gruppo europeo di consulenza ingegneristica e IT operativa facente parte del Gruppo MoOngy.

Presente in 11 Paesi europei con oltre 8500 dipendenti, abbiamo aperto la prima sede italiana a Milano e, vista la continua crescita, stiamo rafforzando e ampliando il nostro team con persone che condividano gli stessi valori della nostra società: AMBIZIONE, DINAMISMO, VOGLIA DI METTERSI IN GIOCO, il tutto in una realtà in continua evoluzione, nella quale le relazioni umane sono sempre al primo posto.

IL TUO RUOLO

Contribuirai allo sviluppo e all’evoluzione della nostra piattaforma, lavorando su frontend e backend. Sarai coinvolto in tutte le fasi del ciclo di vita del software, partecipando attivamente al rilascio di nuove funzionalità, all'integrazione con sistemi esterni e al miglioramento della qualità del prodotto.

ATTIVITÀ PRINCIPALI

Sviluppo completo delle funzionalità: frontend moderno e backend solido.
Scrittura di test automatici e code review.
Integrazione di API e servizi esterni.
Partecipazione attiva ai processi Agile.
Supporto alla stabilità e crescita della piattaforma.

REQUISITI

Esperienza di almeno 2 anni come Full-stack Developer.
Ottima conoscenza di Python (Django o FastAPI) e JavaScript (React o Angular).
Esperienza con API REST, architetture modulari e integrazioni.
Padronanza di Git e CI/CD.
Conoscenza di Docker e ambienti cloud (preferibilmente AWS).
Esperienza con database relazionali e NoSQL (PostgreSQL, MongoDB).
Attenzione alla qualità del codice, test e documentazione.
Mentalità autonoma, collaborativa e orientata al risultato.




Cosa offriamo?

Contratto a tempo indeterminato
Percorsi di formazione continua per migliorare sia competenze tecniche che trasversali
Supporto costante da parte del team HR e del Business Manager
Opportunità di crescita professionale in un ambiente stimolante e innovativo
Accesso a tecnologie all’avanguardia per lo sviluppo di progetti sfidanti




The world needs you

Crediamo fermamente che la diversità sia una ricchezza. Ci impegniamo a creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, dove ogni persona possa esprimere il proprio potenziale e sentirsi valorizzata. Accogliamo con favore candidature da individui di ogni genere, età, nazionalità, disabilità, orientamento sessuale, religione o stato civile.

Unisciti a noi e fai la differenza!

Show more

Title: Applied Scientist I, Entry Level
Description:
Job_Summary:

Amazon Music is a music platform and online music store that connects fans, artists, and creators through music, podcasts, and culture. The Applied Scientist I role focuses on providing machine learning leadership and building data models to enhance customer experience within the Amazon Music Catalog team.




Responsibilities:

• The Amazon Music Catalog team is responsible for persisting, computing, reconciling and vending Music rights and metadata to other teams and services across Amazon.

• We process millions of updates per day and our services serve tens of thousands of requests per secs to all Amazon Music Customers.

• We own critical platforms that makes access to the Amazon Music Catalog highly available and accessible to every one.

• As an Applied Scientist, you will provide machine learning leadership to the team that helps accelerate the business.

• You will build various data and machine learning models that help us innovate different ways to enhance customer experience.




Qualifications:




-Required:

• Master's degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, machine learning or equivalent quantitative field

• Experience programming in Java, C++, Python or related language




-Preferred:

• Experience implementing algorithms using both toolkits and self-developed code

• Have publications at top-tier peer-reviewed conferences or journals

• Experience of using python libraries - pytorch, numpy, scipy, scikit.

• Experience in data analytics and building and maintaining scalable systems.




Company:

Amazon Music is a music platform and online music store that connects fans, artists, and creators through music, podcasts, and culture. It is a sub-organization of Amazon. Amazon Music has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: AI Perception Engineer
Description:
About Bifrost

At Bifrost, we believe that AI has the power to transform lives across the globe. Our goal is to make this future a reality by empowering today's builders with the tools to surpass the physical limitations of our world.

We've developed generative AI tools that enable users to create stunning 3D worlds and synthetic images. Our users train Physical AI systems in record time, unlocking incredible new capabilities like landing spacecraft on Mars, detecting pirates in the Atlantic Ocean, and mapping the world's changing infrastructure from space.

tl;dr


Work on cutting-edge computer vision problems with real-world impact. Help build and deploy products that land spacecraft on Mars, protect fragile rainforests, and detect pirates at sea.
Become a key partner for our customers by working closely with their teams to identify challenges and co-develop tailored AI and computer vision solutions.
Be part of an exceptional, ambitious, and diverse team.
Competitive salary and equity compensation.
Backed by the world's best investors: Carbide Ventures, Airbus Ventures, Peak XV Partners (fka Sequoia Capital), Lux Capital, Wavemaker Partners, Techstars and more.
Guided by esteemed mentors from world-class organizations such as NASA, YC & Google. Committed to helping you grow personally and professionally.
Learn about startups, VC, AI, space, robotics, and autonomous vehicles.


Your Main Quest

We are looking for an AI Perception Engineer (with Solutioning and Forward Deployed skills) who thrives at the intersection of technology and problem-solving. You will collaborate with our customers to deeply understand their challenges, then work hands-on to develop and deploy AI-powered solutions using computer vision and 3D simulation technologies.

Key Responsibilities:


Work closely with customer teams to identify the root of their technical problems and figure out the best solutions using Bifrost's AI capabilities.
Develop and deploy perception and computer vision models tailored to solve unique customer challenges.
Bridge the gap between customer needs and internal engineering/product teams to design, refine, and integrate AI-driven solutions that exceed customer expectations.
Serve as a key technical advisor throughout the sales engagement process, understanding customer workflows and advocating for Bifrost’s solutions.
Continuously collaborate with product, AI, and engineering teams to improve our platform based on real-world feedback and use cases.
Present product demonstrations, Proofs-of-Concept (POCs), and share insights with customer stakeholders ranging from engineers to executives.
Become a recognized voice of the company in the industry, representing Bifrost at live/virtual events, meetups, and within technical communities.


Qualifications:


4+ years experience in customer-facing engineering, with hands-on expertise in computer vision and machine learning. (2-4 can apply too)
Deep understanding of Python, computer vision libraries (e.g., OpenCV, PyTorch), and experience in building AI/ML models.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, able to distill complex technical concepts into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills, with a drive to understand the customer's needs and develop innovative solutions.
Experience collaborating with product and engineering teams, ensuring that customer feedback is integrated into future development.
Bonus: Experience with Unreal or Unity gaming engines.
Bonus: Prior experience working in DevRel, technical evangelism, or forward-deployed roles.
Bonus: Familiarity with 3D tools like Unreal Engine, Unity, or similar, and a willingness to engage with simulation and 3D asset modification when needed (Blender knowledge is a plus).


Why Bifrost?


Inclusive, judgment-free and safe space to be yourself.
Small team - no red tape and bureaucracy to wade through.
Project ownership - take charge and unleash your skills!
Discover how your skills can be applied to AI - another tool in your toolbelt.
Flexible working hours.


What It's Like Working With Us

Enjoy a focused, dedicated working environment where we never forget how to have a bit of fun! We love out-of-the-box thinkers and problem-solvers who relish collaboration and growth.


Show more

Title: Applied AI Engineer
Description:
General Description

Argon is building an AI powered OS for pharma. We’re building deep integrations across pharma’s data systems to build a layer of artificial intelligence to power broad decision making assistance. We’re excited to enable the next generation of scientists and pharma companies to bring life saving therapies to market faster and more efficiently.

This role is right for you if you want to build hundred-step agents, design the future of human and machine interactions, and directly impact the rate of progress in both AI and human health.

We’re partnering with some of the biggest names in pharma and have strong early traction with a healthy pipeline to grow into. We are well funded and backed by top investors, including Y Combinator, Wireframe Ventures, and Crosslink Capital.

We value kindness, intensity, direct communication, intellectual honesty, and grit. Join us if you want to be productive, ship, and help build Argon AI.

This is an in-person role based out of our NYC offices.

Responsibilities

As a Founding Applied AI Scientist / Engineer at Argon, you will help lead our AI efforts. Your efforts will be focused on building domain specific AI and RAG systems on top of large pharma datasets. We are looking for individuals with past AI / ML experience that are excited about building the agentic pharma systems of the future.


Balancing product and research. You want to operate at the frontier of applied AI. You stay up to date with research on prompting techniques, model capabilities, domain specific finetuning
Master of prompts & agentic workflows. You’ll lead our efforts to get models to perform how we want them to. This includes getting the right tone & format but also enabling models with tool use, in-context-learning (ICL), and other techniques to get the very best out of the LLMs.
Building a proprietary dataset. Work with the team to commission the creation of pharma workflows specific datasets that can be used for continued pre-training, RLHF, in-context-learning (ICL), and other applications.
Create a fine-tuning strategy. Lead the team in thinking through domain-specific fine tuning and model training and deploy resources thoughtfully to help us achieve SOTA performance on pharma specific benchmarks
Create evaluations & benchmarks. Design and run the first even pharma domain specific benchmarks for model performance on very specific pharma operational tasks.


Who you are


You bridge research and product. You love to stay on top of the latest research for models, prompting techniques, and how best to utilize LLMs and other AI systems, but you are an engineer at heart. You want to deploy the latest research and build things.
AI native. You’ve been working with LLMs for the past few years and are comfortable working with vector databases, RAG systems, and prompting. You’re driven to stay up to date with SOTA techniques and models to get the most out of advances in AI.
Ambitious. You are excited about working at a fast growing venture backed start-up where you will lead and have initiative in managing major projects to completion.
A hacker. You build quickly, and you find your way to information. Constantly curious and have a serious bias towards action


Compensation

Salary can range between $170,000 and $250,000 and will include generous equity grants.
Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Job Title: AI Engineer




Job Type: Full-Time




Location: Remote




About Us:

At micro1 we’re building the AI recruitment engine that will match 1 billion people with their dream role while helping companies vet talent 100x faster. We’re currently a team of 35 & raised $6.6M at the latest valuation of $80M. We work with top AI Labs to train their models with post-training human data. If you’d like to help build the best AI Recruiter agent & work with top AI Labs to train frontier models, apply to join our core team.




Job Summary:

Join us as an AI Engineer and help shape the future of recruiting technology. In this role, you’ll work side-by-side with Zara, our cutting-edge AI Recruiter model—an industry-first system that’s redefining how companies identify, evaluate, and engage top talent at scale. If you’re passionate about pushing the boundaries of AI and want your work to directly influence the evolution of intelligent automation in talent acquisition, this is the role for you.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and deploy scalable AI models using Python and AWS for various applications.
Design and implement advanced LLMs and integrate them with existing systems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and deliver optimal AI solutions.
Utilize LangChain and FastAPI to create efficient API frameworks and enhance system performance.
Write clear and comprehensive documentation and facilitate knowledge sharing across teams.
Conduct code reviews and provide mentorship to junior engineers to foster skill development.
Continuously research and apply new AI technologies to enhance our offerings.




Required Skills and Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Proven experience in Python programming and working with AWS environments.
Extensive experience with LLMs and LangChain.
Proficiency in developing APIs, with experience in FastAPI or Flask.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a focus on clarity and precision.




Preferred Qualifications:

If the candidates are from top universities is a plus.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
About Formation Bio

Formation Bio is a tech and AI driven pharma company differentiated by radically more efficient drug development.

Advancements in AI and drug discovery are creating more candidate drugs than the industry can progress because of the high cost and time of clinical trials. Recognizing that this development bottleneck may ultimately limit the number of new medicines that can reach patients, Formation Bio, founded in 2016 as TrialSpark Inc., has built technology platforms, processes, and capabilities to accelerate all aspects of drug development and clinical trials. Formation Bio partners, acquires, or in-licenses drugs from pharma companies, research organizations, and biotechs to develop programs past clinical proof of concept and beyond, ultimately helping to bring new medicines to patients. The company is backed by investors across pharma and tech, including a16z, Sequoia, Sanofi, Thrive Capital, Sam Altman, John Doerr, Spark Capital, SV Angel Growth, and others.

You Can Read More At The Following Links


Our Vision for AI in Pharma
Our Current Drug Portfolio
Our Technology & Platform


At Formation Bio, our values are the driving force behind our mission to revolutionize the pharma industry. Every team and individual at the company shares these same values, and every team and individual plays a key part in our mission to bring new treatments to patients faster and more efficiently.

About The Position

As a Senior Data Scientist at Formation Bio, you will be at the forefront of revolutionizing drug development through AI and advanced analytics. In this role, you'll lead crucial initiatives that directly impact our drug development portfolio, from developing sophisticated models for patient selection to creating AI-powered solutions for clinical trial optimization. You'll work at the intersection of computational biology, machine learning, and drug development, collaborating with cross-functional teams to translate complex biological data into actionable insights. This position offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of pharmaceutical development by leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies while making a meaningful impact on patient lives.

Responsibilities


Lead and execute complex data science projects that directly advance our drug development portfolio
Develop and implement sophisticated models for therapeutic hypothesis evaluation, including patient stratification and biomarker identification
Design and create AI models for modernizing clinical trial evaluations, including surrogate endpoints
Aid in the development and training of AI agents to automate and optimize biomedical workflows
Collaborate cross-functionally with clinical, technical, and research teams
Present complex analytical findings to senior stakeholders, including executive leadership


About You

Required Qualifications


PhD in computational sciences or life sciences
3+ years of post-academic experience in life sciences (biotech, pharma, consulting)
Strong programming skills, particularly in Python
Extensive experience in multi-modal bioinformatics analysis


Preferred Qualifications


Proven expertise in cloud computing environments, including proficiency with tabular and/or graph databases
Strong background in machine learning and deep learning, particularly in biological applications
Experience with large language models (LLM)
Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with engineering teams on production systems
Strong communication skills with proven ability to present complex technical findings to senior stakeholders


Formation Bio is prioritizing hiring in key hubs, primarily the New York City and Boston metro areas, with additional growth in the Research Triangle (NC) and San Francisco Bay Area. Please only apply if you reside in these locations or are willing to relocate.

Compensation

The target salary range for this role is: $170,000 - $215,000.

Salary ranges are informed by a number of factors including geographic location. The range provided includes base salary only. In addition to base salary, we offer equity, comprehensive benefits, generous perks, hybrid flexibility, and more. If this range doesn't match your expectations, please still apply because we may have something else for you.

You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.


Show more

Every team and individual at the company shares these same values, and every team and individual plays a key part in our mission to bring new treatments to patients faster and more efficiently.

About The Position

As a Senior Data Scientist at Formation Bio, you will be at the forefront of revolutionizing drug development through AI and advanced analytics. In this role, you'll lead crucial initiatives that directly impact our drug development portfolio, from developing sophisticated models for patient selection to creating AI-powered solutions for clinical trial optimization. You'll work at the intersection of computational biology, machine learning, and drug development, collaborating with cross-functional teams to translate complex biological data into actionable insights. This position offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of pharmaceutical development by leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies while making a meaningful impact on patient lives.

Responsibilities

  • Lead and execute complex data science projects that directly advance our drug development portfolio
  • Develop and implement sophisticated models for therapeutic hypothesis evaluation, including patient stratification and biomarker identification
  • Design and create AI models for modernizing clinical trial evaluations, including surrogate endpoints
  • Aid in the development and training of AI agents to automate and optimize biomedical workflows
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with clinical, technical, and research teams
  • Present complex analytical findings to senior stakeholders, including executive leadership

About You

Required Qualifications

  • PhD in computational sciences or life sciences
  • 3+ years of post-academic experience in life sciences (biotech, pharma, consulting)
  • Strong programming skills, particularly in Python
  • Extensive experience in multi-modal bioinformatics analysis

Preferred Qualifications

  • Proven expertise in cloud computing environments, including proficiency with tabular and/or graph databases
  • Strong background in machine learning and deep learning, particularly in biological applications
  • Experience with large language models (LLM)
  • Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with engineering teams on production systems
  • Strong communication skills with proven ability to present complex technical findings to senior stakeholders

Formation Bio is prioritizing hiring in key hubs, primarily the New York City and Boston metro areas, with additional growth in the Research Triangle (NC) and San Francisco Bay Area. Please only apply if you reside in these locations or are willing to relocate.

Compensation

The target salary range for this role is: $170,000 - $215,000.

Salary ranges are informed by a number of factors including geographic location. The range provided includes base salary only. In addition to base salary, we offer equity, comprehensive benefits, generous perks, hybrid flexibility, and more. If this range doesn't match your expectations, please still apply because we may have something else for you.

You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Title: AI & GEN AI Data Scientist-Experienced Associate - Entry Level
Description:
Job_Summary:

PwC is a leading company that helps clients drive their companies to the leading edge. They are seeking an Experienced Associate to leverage data and advanced analytics techniques to help clients optimize operations and achieve strategic goals.




Responsibilities:

• Building of GenAI and AI solutions, including but not limited to analytical model development and implementation, prompt engineering, general all-purpose programming (e.g., Python), testing, communication of results, front end and back-end integration, and iterative development with clients

• Documenting and analyzing business processes for AI and Generative AI opportunities, including gathering of requirements, creation of initial hypotheses, and development of GenAI and AI solution approach

• Collaborating with client team to understand their business problem and select the appropriate analytical models and approaches for AI and GenAI use cases

• Designing and solutioning AI/GenAI architectures for clients, specifically for plugin-based solutions (i.e., ChatClient application with plugins) and custom AI/GenAI application builds

• Processing unstructured and structured data to be consumed as context for LLMs, including but not limited to embedding of large text corpus, generative development of SQL queries, building connectors to structured databases

• Support management of daily operations of a global data and analytics team on client engagements, review developed models, provide feedback and assist in analysis

• Directing data engineers and other data scientists to deliver efficient solutions to meet client requirements

• Leading and contributing to development of proof of concepts, pilots, and production use cases for clients while working in cross-functional teams

• Structuring, write, communicate and facilitate client presentations

• Directing associates through coaching, providing feedback, and guiding work performance.




Qualifications:




-Required:

• Bachelor's Degree

• 1 year(s) of experience

• Building of GenAI and AI solutions, including but not limited to analytical model development and implementation, prompt engineering, general all-purpose programming (e.g., Python), testing, communication of results, front end and back-end integration, and iterative development with clients

• Documenting and analyzing business processes for AI and Generative AI opportunities, including gathering of requirements, creation of initial hypotheses, and development of GenAI and AI solution approach

• Collaborating with client team to understand their business problem and select the appropriate analytical models and approaches for AI and GenAI use cases

• Designing and solutioning AI/GenAI architectures for clients, specifically for plugin-based solutions (i.e., ChatClient application with plugins) and custom AI/GenAI application builds

• Processing unstructured and structured data to be consumed as context for LLMs, including but not limited to embedding of large text corpus, generative development of SQL queries, building connectors to structured databases

• Support management of daily operations of a global data and analytics team on client engagements, review developed models, provide feedback and assist in analysis

• Directing data engineers and other data scientists to deliver efficient solutions to meet client requirements

• Leading and contributing to development of proof of concepts, pilots, and production use cases for clients while working in cross-functional teams

• Structuring, write, communicate and facilitate client presentations

• Directing associates through coaching, providing feedback, and guiding work performance

• Managing AI/GenAI application development teams including back-end and front-end integrations

• Using Python (e.g., Pandas, NLTK, Scikit-learn, Keras etc.), common LLM development frameworks (e.g., Langchain, Semantic Kernel), Relational storage (SQL), Non-relational storage (NoSQL)

• Experience in analytical techniques such as Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Optimization

• Vectorization and embedding, prompt engineering, RAG (retrieval, augmented, generation) workflow dev

• Understanding or hands on experience with Azure, AWS, and / or Google Cloud platforms

• Experience with Git Version Control, Unit/Integration/End-to-End Testing, CI/CD, release management, etc.




Company:

At PwC, we help clients drive their companies to the leading edge.

Title: Data Analyst Remote
Company: Better Homes and Gardens Real Estate Advantage Realty
Description:
Job Overview

We are seeking a motivated and analytical individual to fill the role of Remote Data Analyst. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys working with numbers, solving problems, and turning data into actionable insights-all from the comfort of home.

Minimum Requirements

Responsibilities:


Collect, process, and analyze data from various sources
Prepare reports and visualizations to present findings to internal teams
Support business decisions with data-driven insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs
Maintain and update dashboards for ongoing performance tracking


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business, or related field (or equivalent experience)
Proficiency with Excel, SQL, and at least one data visualization tool (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and manage time effectively
Clear written and verbal communication


Job Details


Location: Remote (Work from anywhere)
Type: Part-time
Salary: $30–$40/hour depending on experience
Benefits: Paid training, remote work flexibility, professional development opportunities
remote analyst job, full-time work from home, data science, entry-level analyst, virtual reporting support

Title: Lead AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Who are we?

At Finastra, we are a dynamic global provider of open finance software solutions, dedicated to expanding access to financial services. Our innovative applications span Lending, Payments, Treasury and Capital Markets, and Universal Banking. Proudly serving over 8,000 customers, including 45 of the world's top 50 banks, we aim to boost financial inclusion for all. Join us and be part of a vibrant company that embraces diverse perspectives, and is committed to doing well by doing good.

About The Role

We are seeking an exceptional Lead AI/ML Engineer to provide strategic leadership and implementation for our organization's artificial intelligence and machine learning initiatives. The ideal candidate will be a strong technical leader with extensive experience architecting, implementing, and scaling enterprise-grade AI/ML systems. This role requires deep technical expertise across the full AI/ML development lifecycle combined with exceptional leadership capabilities to drive innovation and engineering excellence. A key focus for this role will be developing robust agentic AI solutions scalable across Finastra’s organization.

In this role, you will work with cross-functional engineering teams in designing and implementing cutting-edge AI/ML solutions that transform our business capabilities and deliver significant competitive advantages. You will establish technical direction, architectural standards, and engineering best practices while mentoring and developing the technical capabilities of our organization.

Who We Are

Finastra’s Global Innovation Lab was founded on a simple idea: to push technology boundaries and build the future of finance. From ideation to proof of concepts to fully productized models, the Innovation Lab team is responsible for cutting edge research and development in artificial intelligence, blockchain, cryptocurrency, decentralized finance, and is always pushing development for creating the next great frontier of finance. In a fast-paced environment, we venture into the unknown, develop with the latest algorithms and technology, and collaborate to innovate. We treat data science as a team sport and leverage the diverse skillset of the team to constantly prototype and bring new solutions to market.

What You Will Be Doing


Provide technical leadership and strategic direction for enterprise-wide AI/ML initiatives, establishing architecture patterns and technical standards
Architect and implement highly scalable, resilient AI/ML systems that meet rigorous production requirements for performance, reliability, and security
Develop standards and templates for scalable and production grade AI agent systems
Architect and deploy production grade AI agents for specialized business use cases
Lead the design and development of sophisticated ML platforms, pipelines, and infrastructure to support model development, deployment, and monitoring at scale
Optimize AI/ML systems for production environments with advanced performance engineering techniques
Establish comprehensive MLOps practices that enable continuous integration, delivery, and monitoring of production AI systems
Lead technical innovation by exploring emerging AI/ML technologies and determining their strategic application
Drive technical excellence through code reviews, architecture reviews, and implementation of engineering best practices
Develop architectural roadmaps across the business that align AI capabilities with business objectives and technology strategy
Collaborate with executive stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical solutions
Mentor and develop technical leaders and engineers, building organizational AI/ML engineering capabilities
Establish guidelines and practices for responsible AI development and deployment
Lead the evaluation and integration of new AI/ML tools, frameworks, and platforms into the technology ecosystem


Our Ideal Candidate


Works from an innovation mindset and brining fresh ideas to the table to research and develop
Exhibits leadership by mentoring and developing the skills of junior data scientists
Absorbs and learns new languages, frameworks, and complex topics quickly
Is excited to push technology boundaries and seeks the latest and greatest domains to venture into
Contributes to the technical vision of the data science organization
Applies the latest machine learning research using a business lens
Works well in a team of colleagues with diverse skillsets


What You’ll Need


8+ years of professional software engineering experience with 7+ years focused on ML/AI engineering
Proven experience leading the architecture and implementation of production-grade AI/ML systems at enterprise scale
Expert-level programming abilities in Python and other relevant languages with exceptional software engineering practices
Deep expertise with building and deploying advanced LLM-based applications (e.g. multi-agent systems, agents with tools, etc.)
Extensive experience with MLOps, including design and implementation of ML pipelines, model serving infrastructure, and monitoring systems
Demonstrated success leading architectural decisions for large-scale, business-critical AI initiatives
Expert knowledge of modern software engineering practices including distributed systems design, API development, and microservices architecture
Extensive experience with cloud-native development and deploying AI systems on major cloud platforms
Deep understanding of distributed computing frameworks and large-scale data processing technologies
Strong track record of driving technical innovation and establishing engineering best practices
Experience providing technical leadership across multiple teams and influencing organization-wide technical direction
Exceptional communication skills with ability to articulate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences including executive stakeholders
Demonstrated history of mentoring and developing AI/ML engineers and technical leaders.


Technical Skills


Programming Languages: Expert Python, proficient in Go, Rust, or C++
ML/LLM Frameworks: LangChain, LangGraph, AutoGen, Hugging Face Transformers, PyTorch, TensorFlow, SciKitLearn, etc.
Software Engineering: Distributed systems design, API development, microservices architecture
ML Infrastructure: ML platforms, feature stores, model registries, experiment tracking
MLOps: Advanced CI/CD for ML, ML monitoring, observability, and automated testing frameworks
Vector Databases: Pinecone, Milvus, FAISS, or similar
Cloud & Infrastructure: Cloud expertise (Azure, AWS, GCP, etc.) and familiarity with data and analytics environments (Databricks, etc.)
Development Tools: Advanced Git workflows, CI/CD pipelines
Data Processing: PySpark, Kafka, streaming architectures
Containerization & Orchestration: Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Istio
Security & Compliance: AI security best practices, privacy-preserving ML techniques
Monitoring & Observability: Langsmith, Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog, distributed tracing


For Bonus Points


Advanced degree (MS or PhD) in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or related technical field
Experience leading the development of proprietary ML platforms or frameworks
Deep expertise in ML system performance optimization and scalability engineering
Experience with low-level ML model optimization, quantization, and hardware acceleration
Track record of open-source contributions to significant AI/ML projects or frameworks
Technical publications or patents in AI/ML or software engineering
Expertise in responsible AI governance frameworks and regulatory compliance
Experience leading AI engineering in regulated industries
Background in research and development of novel ML algorithms or techniques


Applicants for this position need to be located in the following cities or their immediate surrounding areas: Atlanta (GA) OR Lake Mary (FL) Due to the requirements of this position, this job posting is not available for, and Finastra will not be considering any, applicants from New York City.

Benefits

We are proud to offer a range of incentives to our employees worldwide. These benefits are available to everyone, regardless of grade, and reflect the values we uphold:


Flexibility: Enjoy unlimited vacation, based on your location and business priorities. Hybrid working arrangements, and inclusive policies such as paid time off for voting, bereavement, and sick leave.
Well-being: Access confidential one-on-one therapy through our Employee Assistance Program, unlimited personalized coaching via our coaching app, and access to our Gather Groups for emotional and mental support.
Medical, life & disability insurance, retirement plan, lifestyle and other benefits*
ESG: Benefit from paid time off for volunteering and donation matching.
DEI: Participate in multiple DE&I groups for open involvement (e.g., Count Me In, Culture@Finastra, Proud@Finastra, Disabilities@Finastra, Women@Finastra).
Career Development: Access online learning and accredited courses through our Skills & Career Navigator tool.
Recognition: Be part of our global recognition program, Finastra Celebrates, and contribute to regular employee surveys to help shape Finastra and foster a culture where everyone is engaged and empowered to perform at their best.
Specific benefits may vary by location.


At Finastra, each individual is unique, bringing their own ideas, thoughts, cultural beliefs, backgrounds, and experiences together. We learn from one another, embrace and celebrate our differences, and create an environment where everyone feels safe to be themselves.

Be unique, be exceptional, and help us make a difference at Finastra!

Applicants for this position need to be located in the following cities or their immediate surrounding areas: Austin/Lake Mary (Orlando). Due to the requirements of this position, this job posting is not available for, and Finastra will not be considering any applicants who currently reside in New York City or California

Title: Virtual Data Entry Assistant ( 100% Remote)
Description:
As a Data Entry Associate, you will play a crucial role in maintaining and updating accurate information within our database systems. Your primary responsibilities will include inputting data from various sources into our databases, ensuring data integrity, and performing regular quality checks. Attention to detail, accuracy, and a methodical approach are essential for success in this role. You will collaborate with other team members to meet deadlines and contribute to the overall efficiency of our data management processes.

Minimum Requirements

Key Responsibilities


Accurately input data from source documents into the company database.
Perform regular data quality checks to identify and correct errors.
Verify and ensure the accuracy of data by comparing it with source documents.
Organize and maintain files and records in an organized manner.
Collaborate with team members to meet data entry deadlines.
Adhere to data confidentiality and security policies. Identify and report any data discrepancies or issues to the supervisor.
Assist in maintaining and updating procedural documentation related to data entry tasks.
Respond promptly to data inquiries and provide support as needed.
Contribute to continuous improvement efforts in data management processes.


Qualifications


High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or training in data entry is a plus.
Proven experience in data entry or a related role.
Proficient in using data entry software and Microsoft Office applications.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Good communication skills, both written and verbal.
Familiarity with data confidentiality principles is a plus.
Ability to handle repetitive tasks with a high level of consistency.
Problem-solving skills and the ability to identify and report data discrepancies.


Benefits


Excellent weekly pay
Safe work environment
Multiple shifts are offered from early morning to night and no experience is required.
You will have ample opportunity for growth
Part-time offered - pick the days you wish to work
A commitment to promote from within


Join our team as a Data Entry Associate and contribute to the efficiency and accuracy of our data management processes. We value attention to detail, accuracy, and a commitment to maintaining the highest standards in data integrity.
Show more

As a Data Entry Associate, you will play a crucial role in maintaining and updating accurate information within our database systems. Your primary responsibilities will include inputting data from various sources into our databases, ensuring data integrity, and performing regular quality checks. Attention to detail, accuracy, and a methodical approach are essential for success in this role. You will collaborate with other team members to meet deadlines and contribute to the overall efficiency of our data management processes.

Minimum Requirements

Key Responsibilities

  • Accurately input data from source documents into the company database.
  • Perform regular data quality checks to identify and correct errors.
  • Verify and ensure the accuracy of data by comparing it with source documents.
  • Organize and maintain files and records in an organized manner.
  • Collaborate with team members to meet data entry deadlines.
  • Adhere to data confidentiality and security policies. Identify and report any data discrepancies or issues to the supervisor.
  • Assist in maintaining and updating procedural documentation related to data entry tasks.
  • Respond promptly to data inquiries and provide support as needed.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement efforts in data management processes.

Qualifications

  • High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or training in data entry is a plus.
  • Proven experience in data entry or a related role.
  • Proficient in using data entry software and Microsoft Office applications.
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
  • Good communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Familiarity with data confidentiality principles is a plus.
  • Ability to handle repetitive tasks with a high level of consistency.
  • Problem-solving skills and the ability to identify and report data discrepancies.

Benefits

  • Excellent weekly pay
  • Safe work environment
  • Multiple shifts are offered from early morning to night and no experience is required.
  • You will have ample opportunity for growth
  • Part-time offered - pick the days you wish to work
  • A commitment to promote from within

Join our team as a Data Entry Associate and contribute to the efficiency and accuracy of our data management processes. We value attention to detail, accuracy, and a commitment to maintaining the highest standards in data integrity.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Behavior Planning & Prediction - Entry Level
Description:
Job_Summary:

Woven by Toyota is enabling Toyota’s transformation into a mobility company, focusing on human-centric innovation. They are seeking a skilled Machine Learning Engineer to design and implement innovative machine learning models for autonomous driving, influencing millions of Toyota production vehicles.




Responsibilities:

• Support the design and the development of advanced machine learning models in the behavior space specifically tailored for autonomous vehicles utilizing deep learning and large-scale data analysis.

• Drive projects through the execution phase, requiring minimal guidance by a senior engineer.

• Deploy scalable and efficient ML models on our autonomous vehicle platform.

• Integrate modern technologies with rigorous safety standards while maintaining cost efficiency.

• Significantly help developing needed components for end-to-end ML training and deployment, from data strategy to optimization and validation.

• Write high-quality code while being rigorous with Machine Learning experimentation.

• Work in a high-velocity environment and employ agile development practices.

• Collaborate closely with teams such as Perception, Simulation, Infrastructure, Data and Tooling to drive unified solutions.




Qualifications:




-Required:

• B.S, M.S in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Robotics or related quantitative fields, or equivalent industry experience.

• 2+ years of strong experience with Python, any major deep learning framework, and software engineering best practices

• Comfortable in writing C++ code to help integrate with our autonomous vehicle platform.

• 2+ years of experience with deep learning approaches such as supervised/unsupervised learning, transfer learning, multi-task learning, and/or deep reinforcement learning.

• Solid experience with learning-based planning approaches like imitation learning, reinforcement learning and state-of-the-art techniques for sequential modeling like Transformer architectures

• 2+ years of experience covering machine learning workflows, data sampling and curation, pre-processing, model training, ablation studies, evaluation, deployment, and inference optimization.

• Passionate about self driving car technology and its potential for humanity.

• Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate concepts clearly and precisely.




-Preferred:

• Hands-on experience with autonomous driving systems

• Experience with model deployment with NVIDIA stack (e.g. ONNX graphs, TensorRT, profiling)

• Familiarity with recent breakthroughs in ML (e.g. foundation models, pre-training and efficient fine-tuning, multimodal Transformer architectures)

• Knowledge of autonomous driving large scale data curation pipelines




Company:

Woven by Toyota improve the vehicle intelligence software and operation and accelerate the Toyota Mobility Concept. Woven by Toyota has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Show more

Title: Part-time Associate - 827 Turlock
Description:
827 - Turlock Extra

Starting Rate $16.50 per hour

Do you?


Provide excellent Customer Service?
Love your Community?
Love Food?


Join our Smart & Final store operations team as a Part-time Associate - 827 Turlock!

Store Location

651 N. GOLDEN STATE BLVD.

TURLOCK, California, 95380

United States

Who We Are

With a history that spans more than 150 years, Smart & Final offers customers fresh produce, quality meats and groceries as well as more than 3,000 club-sized items to fit every budget and need. We are the smaller, faster grocery warehouse store - without the membership fee.

We proudly give back to the communities we serve through the help of the Smart & Final Charitable Foundation, donating more than $1 million and volunteering over 1,000 hours each year.

As part of the Chedraui USA group of companies, our mission is to provide customers with an exceptional shopping experience with the freshest selection available across all our retail banners, and our people are at the heart of what we do.

Our team is continually looking for talented individuals to bring our mission to life. Your success starts here!

What We Bring


401(k) Retirement Benefit
Continuing Education Benefits
And Much More!


What You'll Bring

Candidates should possess the ability to


Read and write English, interact with general public and co-workers.
Read and comprehend simple instructions, product labels, product pricing codes, shelf tags, short correspondence, and memos.
Write simple correspondence.
Effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.
Apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions.
Regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 45 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 60 pounds.


It Would Be Extra Awesome if you brought...


Basic PC/Outlook skills
Retail Management Certificate


The Opportunity

The Part-Time Associate reports to the Store Manager and performs management-assigned duties, which may include but may not be limited to receiving inventory, stocking and maintaining a store section, operating a cash register, carry-out services and store cleaning.

Specific Duties Include, But Are Not Limited To


Maintain a store section as assigned and may order, receive and stock merchandise using proper equipment, assures proper pricing on merchandise, checks product date codes to validate proper rotation, stocks shelves, end displays, floor stacks, displays and refrigerated/frozen cases. May prepare perishable products for sale. Sets up advertising/promotional displays. Reviews invoices/bills for accuracy.
Cleans and maintains sanitation standards in all interior and exterior areas of store and parking lot as directed by store management.
Operates a cash register, receives payment from customers, and makes change or processes check/charge/debit transactions. Processes cash and/or credit refunds, when approved by management. Verifies customer eligibility when selling alcoholic beverages.
Offers friendly, knowledgeable, efficient and courteous assistance to customers by providing them with current store and product information. When requested, loads customer purchases by assisting customers to their vehicles.
Performs basic bookkeeping duties. Records lost/damaged goods and store supplies using appropriate tools.


Our company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics.
Show more

Title: Talent Acquisition Associate | Human Resources | Full-time | Days
Description:
JOB_DESCRIPTION.SHARE.HTML

CAROUSEL_PARAGRAPH

JOB_DESCRIPTION.SHARE.HTML


St. Augustine, Florida
Professional-NonClinical
52613


mail_outline

Get future jobs matching this search

or

Overview

Job Description

The Talent Acquisition Associate is responsible for sourcing, screening, interviewing, and onboarding. Acts as a recruiter for sourcing candidates and applies a screening process that allows for the best selection of candidates. Assists in the lifecycle of an employee through onboarding, retaining, and exit interviewing. This position is Integral to attaining the best talent and collaborates with leaders throughout the Hospital to achieve this.

Responsibilities


Manages all aspects of recruiting programs and processes appropriate to meet UF Health St. John’s ongoing staffing requirements and needs.
Manages internal and external Job Postings by creating, sourcing, screening, and delivering the most valuable candidates to Hospital Administration, Directors, and management personnel.
Develops and promotes, in conjunction with the hospital’s Marketing Department, employment branding for UF Health St. Johns and markets and promotes UF Health’s “total value proposition” to potential applicants and candidates for employment throughout advertisement and recruitment.
Manages new employee onboarding process from new employee processing through new employee orientation. Coordinates with Administration and Directors to create and facilitate new employee orientation materials, presentations, and overall NEO experience.
Create New Employee Files and perform pre-employment processing of paperwork required (i.e. W4, I-9, etc.). Coordinates criminal background checks and drug testing for new hires, and background checks on chaplains.
Creates and manages new employee data and status change entries in HRIS as applicable. Communicates HRIS entries to appropriate HR, Educational, and Information Systems personnel.
Process employment status change requests (transfer, status change, and termination); Tracks and releases information to payroll, benefits, and necessary personnel. Conducts exit interviewing when applicable.
Negotiates agreements with, maintains and manages relationships as to, and supervises and monitors utilization of traveler and temporary agencies in regard to hospital’s short-term staffing and labor needs. Coordinates fulfillment of such staffing needs with respective hospital departments and Directors. Tracks, reviews and approves invoicing and payments for such temporary staffing services.
Maintains and produces regular reports of data, information and statistics regarding performance, cost, effectiveness and efficiency of recruiting programs and onboarding processes.


Qualifications

Education / Training


Associate's Degree in Human Resources, Healthcare Administration, or Related Area of Study


Preferences:

Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Healthcare Administration, or Related Area of Study

Experience Requirements


1-year Recruiting experience preferred
2-year Human Resources or Business Office experience preferred


Preferences:

2 years of recruiting and/or onboarding experience working in a healthcare setting

Experience working with an applicant tracking system and human resources information systems.

Certificates/Licenses/Registration


Valid Driver’s License


Preferences:

PHR or SHRM-CP
